jobs_requirement:
CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Description:
As a Sr. Lead Product Manager, you will own the product lifecycle of CenturyLink‰Ûªs cloud-based Managed Security Services portfolio by collaborating with internal teams to define, prioritize, focus, and deliver new and innovative solutions to a global enterprise customer base. The candidate must have demonstrated experience developing or supporting products for security services globally. The successful candidate will have exceptional leadership and execution skills with an ability to both define strategy and execute at a tactical level. The candidate must be a strong strategic thinker who is knowledgeable in emerging security technology trends in the marketplace.
Key Qualifications:
The Security Product Manager will have end-to-end responsibility for supporting CenturyLink's Managed Security Services platform including product features/requirements, roadmaps, drive use cases, user personas, and release plans for product features.
Identify a variety of customer needs across the product stack, drive feature prioritization and work closely with internal organizations to deliver successful products.
Understand customer needs and requirements and detail them in PRDs.
Define, track, interpret and report on key business metrics and drive activities which support continued development of service features within the platform.
Support planning, execution and go-to-market activities by closely working with the Product Marketing team.
Lead analysis and strategy formulation to determine business opportunities that align with department goals and prioritize MSS services focusing on new revenue streams.
Strong communication skills to ensure alignment across the business and ability to communicate product plans for portfolio solutions to all stakeholders and senior management.
Desired Skills and Experience:
8+ years‰Ûª product management experience in a security related field
Technical expertise and knowledge in Managed Security services
Excellent interpersonal, written and presentation skills with the ability to successfully communicate ideas and recommendations to all levels within an organization characterized by clarity and brevity.
Excellent organizational skills to juggle many tasks without losing sight of what‰Ûªs most important
Demonstrated experience creating product specifications, performing competitive analysis, and/or market research
Self-motivated, results-driven individual
Bachelor's degree, B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent field with MS or MBA preferred
Development using agile development processes a plus
Experience with Managed Security Services in a Federal Government setting a plus
Alternate Location: US-California-Santa Clara; US-Colorado-Denver; US-Louisiana-Monroe; US-Virgina-Arlington; US-Virgina-Herndon; US-Work From Home-Work At Home
Requisition #: 28613
Company Statement
CenturyLink is an industry-leading provider of communications, high speed Internet and entertainment services from coast to coast. Our combination of business and residential service solutions ‰ÛÒ including home and wireless voice solutions and digital television ‰ÛÒ provide innovative solutions to our customers. CenturyLink is proud to be a participant in the U.S. General Services Administration Networx program, the largest communications services contract in the world. CenturyLink offers you the opportunity to develop and cultivate your career as we lead the communications industry into the future.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Overview:
We have an immediate opening for a Customer Service Technician to install telephone plant facilities and high-speed internet at customer premises according to specifications directed and established by CenturyLink procedures. Also to maintain, expand, replace and repair all plant facilities and subscriber apparatus required to provide service to customers. This position interacts directly with CenturyLink customers.
Job Duties:
Perform installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of high-speed internet, video and voice networks including associated wiring and equipment.
Perform maintenance and repair on outside plant facilities.
Use a shovel and pick to dig up and bury cable; and may be required to work in manholes or controlled environmental vaults (CEV).
Locate buried telephone cables.
Observe all safety rules and regulations.
Assist other Technical personnel in the performance of their duties when requested.
Convey a positive and professional appearance and demeanor when communicating the company‰Ûªs products and services to our customers.
Actively support sales and marketing related activities.
Assume all other duties as assigned
Minimum Qalifications:
Education: High School Diploma or GED.
Two (2) years of current telecommunications industry experience in one or more of the following areas: installation, maintenance, and repair of aerial, buried and underground wire and cable; High Speed Internet; station equipment.
Prior experience in a customer facing or customer service operation.
Strong interpersonal communication skills for communicating CenturyLink‰Ûªs products and services to customers.
Ability to visually identify all colors used in telephone cable.
Working knowledge of PC‰Ûªs, including basic computer operational tasks.
Ability to handle 28-foot extension ladders (up to 75 lbs) and manhole covers (up to 150 lbs).
Ability to work in confined spaces.
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions and at various hours of the day/night.
Ability to respond to after hour call-outs, work overtime, shift, weekends, and holidays as required.
Ability to travel overnight as necessary for business requirements and training.
Possession of a valid driver‰Ûªs license, with proven ability to safely operate company vehicles and equipment, and maintain a safe driving record.
Preferred Qualifications:
Training on basic IT and network fundamentals.
Experience or training in how to read and interpret outside and subscriber plant facility records.
Internet protocol telephony exposure.
Electronics training or experience that demonstrates knowledge of AC/DC theory.
Knowledge of analog and digital transmission.
Alternate Location: US-Virgina-Luray
Requisition #: 51509

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
About CenturyLink Cloud
CenturyLink Cloud (CLC) is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Corporation. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused Dev/Ops culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity. We build the cloud, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run: Every day, all the time. It‰Ûªs what we do.
At CLC, we‰Ûªve created an environment where people come together to work hard and drive results, but also offer flexibility and work-life balance. CLC is a high growth venture-backed company recognized by industry analysts as an up-and-coming cloud service provider and an innovator in cloud software.
Job Summary:
We have an opening for an experienced Senior Software Development Engineer to expand our team of engineers who are developing CenturyLink‰Ûªs cloud infrastructure.
Just like everyone else, we want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Oh, yeah, they have to love to learn new things, too. You should have a passion for cloud computing and for creating applications and services that make developers‰Ûª lives easier while helping them create their enterprise-ready applications. Limiting yourself to just one area of the technology stack would be unthinkable for this kind of developer, so we hope that you are comfortable doing everything from creating beautiful, friendly UIs, to crafting logical and easy to use APIs, all the way to writing distributed computing algorithms between applications running on entirely different clouds.
Since our teams operate using a combination of agile development practices and processes, you‰Ûªd be encouraged to work in pairs, write your code test first, and think about things like cycle time and WIP limits. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day.
Requirements/Qualifications:
‰Û¢ 7+ years‰Ûª software development experience.
‰Û¢ 5+ years‰Ûª experience with a modern programming language like; C#, Ruby, Go or JavaScript.
‰Û¢ 3+ years‰Ûª of experience designing, building and operating highly available, highly reliable web-based systems
‰Û¢ Familiarity with programming concurrent and/or distributed systems.
‰Û¢ 2+ years of agile software development experience, TDD and refactoring.
‰Û¢ Experience developing and operating highly available, highly reliable systems.
‰Û¢ Good collaboration and communication skills.
Desired Skills:
In addition strong candidates would have some of the following:
‰Û¢ 2+ years‰Ûª developing distributed cloud architectures and infrastructure.
‰Û¢ Experience with C#, ASP.NET MVC and Web API.
‰Û¢ Experience with using or developing for Cloud Foundry in Ruby, Go.
‰Û¢ Experience with JavaScript and Node.js.
‰Û¢ Experience with SQL databases and document stores (like Couchbase and Elasticsearch) is a plus.
‰Û¢ Solid understanding of web related protocols and standards, such as HTTP, SSL, REST and JSON.
‰Û¢ Linux admin and shell scripting skills.
‰Û¢ Windows admin and PowerShell scripting skills.
Alternate Location: US-Washington-Bellevue
Requisition #: 29313
Company Statement
CenturyLink is an industry-leading provider of communications, high speed Internet and entertainment services from coast to coast. Our combination of business and residential service solutions ‰ÛÒ including home and wireless voice solutions and digital television ‰ÛÒ provide innovative solutions to our customers. CenturyLink is proud to be a participant in the U.S. General Services Administration Networx program, the largest communications services contract in the world. CenturyLink offers you the opportunity to develop and cultivate your career as we lead the communications industry into the future.

Excellent customer and team skills are required.

Closing Date: 3/18/2016

Job requires specialized advanced vocational skills (generally non-theoretical) acquired on or off the job, typically gained through a combination of education and relevant experience, totaling four years post-high school or equivalent.
High school graduate or equivalent, an associate degree in electronics, or two years work related experience or must have completed 12 college credit hours in computer science or electronics subject to company approval.

Accept call-outs and overtime as a condition of employment.

Successfully meet physical requirements; work aloft from ladders, platforms, poles (with climbers), and bucket trucks; safely lift, carry, set up and secure 75 lb ladder; able to load/transport standard nitrogen cylinder.
Possess strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Possess a good attendance, work and safety record.
Work from oral or written instructions with the ability to plan work without direct supervision.
Have neat and legible handwriting
Possess proficient personal computer operation skills.
Must be able to work with internal and external customers.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Operations Technician III
Perform network monitoring and troubleshooting in a 24X7X365 Network Operations Center (NOC).
Job Description
Utilize knowledge and experience to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve simple and complex problems quickly and effectively.
Make use of trouble ticketing system to and document outages.
Coordinate and track RMA requests, to obtain RMA authorization requests and completion of RMA submittal forms
Understand and utilize documented procedures to perform assigned duties.
Perform rekey of crypto equipment and assist field technicians in the rekey and troubleshooting of crypto equipment.
Complete required forms and documentation to sustain operations.
Work independently and as a team member.
Possess knowledge of Wide Area Network security requirements and techniques for protecting computer systems/networks from viruses, data tampering, and unauthorized system entry
Have familiarity of long haul communications equipment such as SONET, ATM, fiber optical multiplexers and DWDM and understanding of LAN/WAN software/hardware technical support; familiarity with optical and IP products, particularly Ciena optical and Cisco IP routing and Juniper devices
Assist technical subject matter expert to support day-to-day network issues and new network commissioning, configuration, testing and implementation.
Provide data to support daily and monthly customer reports, incident reports, and ticket audits
Review and interpret input from several monitoring tools and determines course of action to resolve network issues and outages
Perform other duties as assigned.
Estimated 15% of time is travel; however, the amount of travel is dependent on the current mission requirement and operations environment.
Minimum Qualifications
Experience with SONET based, long-haul and metro transport networks, next-generation DWDM wavelength systems desirable.
Familiarity with various vendor platforms for optical networks ‰ÛÒ Ciena, Cisco, Juniper
Four or more years of experience in a client-server environment required
Experience in Microsoft products to include Active Directory, SQL Server 05/08, Windows Server 03/08, Office SharePoint Server or Windows SharePoint Services Windows Server Update Services (SMS), and Exchange and 2007.
Demonstrated advanced hardware and software troubleshooting skills.
Prior NOC experience desired.
Previous experience with Government networks and customers.
Ability to interface in a professional manner with management and customer.
Ability to work in a high stress environment, collaborate very closely with peers, strong communication skills.
Associate degree in Engineering, Electronics, Software, or Networks
MCSE, CCNA, Security+ desired
Top Secret clearance mandatory and current SCI mandatory

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
The Sales Engineer II is an integral part of our team as they support our sales team in the sales and design of new multi dwelling unit (MDU) and single family home (SFH) communities. The Sales Engineer II is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements discovery, solution design/engineering/consulting, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink's full suite of products and solutions.
The Sales Engineer II is the primary contact for internal partners and external customers relative to network design and performs a wide variety of administrative, technical, and sales duties including, but not limited to, broadband and video needs analysis and network design, assisting in contract negotiation and procurement, recommendation of inside wiring architecture, and location of the demarcation for each property. Additionally, the Sales Engineer II will provide post-sale support including access agreements and customer service issues resolution. The Sales Engineer II will act as customer liaison with the developer contacts, utility contacts and other city departments to provide a high level of customer service as well as coordinate programs and services to meet customer needs.
Job Responsibilities
Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions.
Review of existing records and comparison of records against actual field conditions.
Document where the route will require coordination with other utilities.

Summary:
CLC is looking for a smart, results-oriented Sr. Network Engineer to deploy, develop and maintain current and new network infrastructure and to automate and deploy virtualized network services for customers. This role would be part of the CenturyLink Cloud Networking product team. This role will focus on scalable, resilient and modular networking that allows customers to easily deploy their virtualized network and network services over the CenturyLink Cloud network. A can-do attitude blended together with the ability to deliver results consistently in a collaborative manner is necessary without requiring supervision or motivation.
Responsibilities:
Participate in design, implementation and automation of new network services (virtual and physical) and continue to support products after launch as an escalation point.
Configure Arista, Juniper, and Cisco hardware using best practices for performance and stability.
Research problem information to proactively identify trends and potential sources of new problems and use this information to proactively address these issues to ensure that they do not repeat.
Analyze alerts and infrastructure systems to ensure maximum performance, efficiency, and availability.
Ability to analyze infrastructure usage and plan for growth or increases in system capacity.
Identify and resolve problems affecting the infrastructure performance, efficiency, and availability in a timely manner.
Configure, install, deploy, monitor and troubleshoot network and server hardware, operating systems, and services related to networking, resolving outages and documenting designs, process and procedures.
Identify automation opportunities and assist in their implementation across our global infrastructure.
Requirements/Qualifications:
Phenomenal multi-tenant network design and troubleshooting skills.
Strong knowledge of different types of data flows, including ISCSI, NFS, SIP, RTP, etc.
Strong networking and load balancer skills; Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Citrix / Netscaler, HAProxy
Strong technical knowledge on Windows / Linux / Virtualization (VMware vSphere and KVM) platforms in large enterprise clustered/high availability environment.
Technical knowledge on Microsoft technologies: AD, Exchange
Experience automating new network services (virtual and physical).
Strong understanding of enterprise/service provider infrastructure and large-scale environments.
Strong understanding of BGP, ECMP, VXLAN, ZTP, and MLAG environments.
Experience with virtual switching (Open vSwitch, NSX, etc.)
Strong scripting skills in one or more of the following is preferred: PowerShell/Python/Ruby/shell.
Self-starter with a proven record of overcoming technical and design obstacles.
Desired Experience/Skills
Ability to defend technical decisions but remain open to team input.
Proven self-starter with desire to foster a sense of urgency when addressing customer concerns, coupled with a strong command of business and technical abilities
Data-driven with strong history of using data to drive decisions and solutions
Prior experience with a 24x7, high-availability, broadly-distributed production environments
Ability to work in a high-paced environment
Knowledge of security best practices
Excellent communication and customer service skills
Team player with strong collaboration skills
Flexible, willing to work off-hours when required
Able to work independently and in a team environment
10+ years direct hands on experience working in a customer-facing technical support role
5+ years of experience working in a network architecture/engineering role.
Ability to effectively present information to management, clients, advisory boards and employees

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience required

Requisition 60815
Network Technician- Cable Repair/Cable Maintenance
Classification: Regular Part Time-Scheduled to work at least 1,150 (one thousand one hundred fifty hours) per calendar year. This classification offers the same health benefits as a Regular Full Time employee.
Location: Albany, OR
Please take a moment to view this generic video to learn more about our service techician positions.
This video is not specific to this position . https://vimeo.com/34623506
Job Responsibilities:
Maintains/repairs and tests copper cable and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
Troubleshoots problems that will require cable repair, cable maintenance, air pressure, splicing, faultfinding, etc.
Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried, underground, aerial and building work locations.
Uses heavy-duty power equipment (e.g., compressors, pumps, blowers), hand tools, power tools (air and electric), and specialty tools, including electric and electronic measuring devices (e.g., multi-meters, volt-ohm meters), in the construction and repair of outside plant facilities.
Performs testing and turn-up of subscriber lines, carrier plant, and/or fiber optic plant.
Locates and repairs air leaks in aerial, underground, and/or buried cable.
Locates, joins, repairs and rearranges cable and cable conductors in buildings and aerial or buried plant. Initiates or performs cable cuts, transfer projects, and/or load balance cuts, and issues necessary cuts to prevent blocking.
Installs, maintains/repairs, and tests residential/small business telecommunication service (POTS and DSL).
Connects wires and cables to terminals, and attaches/detaches various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings, and poles.
Performs continuity and/or conformance testing.
Reads and interprets customer service orders, technical (i.e., mechanical, electrical, digital) drawings, maps, blueprints, diagrams, etc.
Receives service orders, worksheets (detailed diagrams describing nature and location of equipment to be installed or repaired) and repair tickets from supervisor or other designated employees and performs specified work.
Works with telecom color-coded wires and cables.
Basic Job Qualifications:
At least six (6) months of experience within the last five years maintaining/repairing and testing copper cable and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
At least six (6) months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
Knowledge of basic electricity, as it relates to telecommunications (through classes or on-the-job training), which includes: knowledge related to the basic principles, theories, and applications of electricity (e.g., voltage, current, resistance, power, grounding, insulation, Ohm‰Ûªs Law, AC/DC); knowledge of basic electrical components (e.g., conductors, insulators, switches, capacitors, inductors, transformers) and basic circuit design; and knowledge of the operation and application of common electrical components and common measurement instruments (e.g., multi-meters, etc.).
Working knowledge of test equipment (e.g., Tech Tad, Sidekick, 965DSP, TBERD, OTDR, transmission measuring sets).
Ability to use established electrical, digital, and/or mechanical principals and to perform appropriate tests to identify and solve problems encountered on the job.
Ability to efficiently and accurately work with multiple types of information and/or perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to complete designated amount of work in a specified timeframe (e.g., quality jobs per day), adjusting work assignments or schedules to meet changing work-related priorities or demands.
Ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over-the-phone.
Ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and to foster a cooperative climate, as well as to work independently in the field with little supervision.
Ability to perceive differences in wire and telecom cable color.
Ability to climb and work at elevations (e.g., from ladders, poles, lift trucks) exceeding 18 feet.
Ability to work in confined spaces (e.g., attics, crawl spaces, utility holes).
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to: lifting objects weighing over 100 pounds. ‰ÛÒ Employment is contingent upon passage of the strength test.
Ability to perform job activities outdoors in different weather conditions (e.g., extreme cold and/or heat, inclement weather).
A valid State driver‰Ûªs license with a current satisfactory driving record.
Ability to work varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, weekends and holidays.
PREFERRED Job Qualifications:
At least 12 months experience within the last five years maintaining/repairing and testing Remote Terminals, copper including designed circuits e.g. T1‰Ûªs, HDSL, ISDN etc. and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
At least 12 months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
General experience in testing and turning up DSL, and Carrier Systems.
Ability to read, review, interpret and understand technical documents (e.g., schematics, drawings, blueprints, layouts).
Prior Customer Service experience.
Ability to recognize and identify sales opportunities that meet the needs of customers and the company, including promoting and closing sales of products and services.
Prior experience working on a computer in a Windows-based system and with Microsoft Outlook.
Prior experience using a body belt and safety straps.
Pole Climbing Certification

Sr. Lead Data Center Account Executive - NY
The Sr Lead Account Executive ‰ÛÒ Colocation is part of the Global Data Center Sales and Alliances organization and is responsible for sales and revenue growth in a geographic territory. CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Overview:
This position will provide technical support to CenturyLink and its U.S based operations, as a member of the support team located in Monroe, LA in the areas of Time Management and SAP Payroll modules.
The individual in this role will collaborate with business users to identify user requirements, assess available options and recommend solutions related to Time and Payroll processes.
In addition, the incumbent assists with development, testing, and support activities related to the maintenance of the SAP TM & PY modules.
This includes analyzing and understanding technical challenges, configuring systems to support identified business processes, and resolving technical issues affecting business process
Job Responsibilities:
‰Û¢ Provide on-going production support in SAP Time and Payroll Management modules, resolve tickets and collaborate with appropriate teams to implement and test system fixes
‰Û¢ Resolve issues related to time evaluation during the payroll processing
‰Û¢ Monitor batch jobs and interfaces and resolve issues
‰Û¢ Provide support to the users in analyzing time management discrepancies
‰Û¢ Research time-related issues and tickets; provide resolution
‰Û¢ Analyze union contracts, Identify business requirements and configure the system using best practices by collaborating with the business users
‰Û¢ Design, develop, test, and implement system or process solutions and/or enhancements
‰Û¢ Configure wage types, holiday calendars, work schedules, attendances, absences and quotas
‰Û¢ Perform HR support and enhancement pack analysis, develop test plan and perform tests
‰Û¢ Extensive hands-on experience writing Personnel Calculation Rules and Schemas required
Develop functional specifications and work closely with the off-shore developers to ensure the requirements and functional designs are translated accurately into technical designs
‰Û¢ Develop test plans, perform tests and work on remediation of issues
Minimum Qualifications:
12 years of progressive SAP design, implementation and support experience
10+ years of experience in configuring and customizing the SAP Time Management module
Hands-on configuration experience working with Wage Types, Features, Schemas and Rules, Holiday Calendars, Work Schedules, Quotas and Time Evaluation
Extensive experience with union contracts, acquisitions and mergers
Strong analytical aptitude with a proven ability to analyze/interpret technical requirements and translate them into system specifications

Operations Engineer - Windows (Tues-Sat)
CenturyLink is a global IT solutions leader that powers the needs of businesses of all sizes through our hybrid IT services including public and private cloud, data centre colocation, managed hosting and network services.
In Europe, we work with leading brands, such as Cancer Research UK, easyJet, Euromoney, G4 Security and Universal Music. Every day we help our clients to deliver agility, innovation and speed to market for their businesses. Every minute they harness the scalability and economics of cloud-based technologies.
An S&P 500 company, CenturyLink is included amongst the Fortune 500 list of America's largest corporations, employing over 48000 people worldwide with operating revenue in excess of 17 billion dollars.
Job Responsibilities:
The Operations Engineer - Windows is a technical specialist working as part of a Hosting Compute team. The hours worked are a standard 8.5 hour day anytime between the hours of 07:00 and 19:00.
The team provides world class support to an enterprise level client base responsible for incident resolution, processing of change requests, and contributions to problem management for all Microsoft platform cases. The candidate will ideally be an IT Graduate and be qualified to an MSCA/MCSE/MCITP level or possess a similar proven track record of experience.
Resolving third level support cases; 90% of which will be resolved without escalation.
Escalating to the relevant Engineering team as required, promptly following procedures and ensuring management is updated accordingly.
Ensuring the Client and ticket is up to date at all times on incident progress.
Maintain, troubleshoot and co-ordinate replacement of faulty hardware.
Involved in the execution of Client Change Requests in a timely manner as planned by Client Service Partner, Engineering and Hosting Compute Manager.
Escalation of critical issues/outages to Hosting Compute Management as per procedures.
Provide detailed feedback to other groups on all incident resolutions, ensuring full details are entered into ticket case notes.
Daily review and action of open cases; updating Operations Management on current cases and their status as appropriate.
Update Operations team on any projects being worked on.
Creation of weekly reports published to the line manager.
To provide comprehensive handovers to global peers at the end of shift.
Attend Daily Operations and Change Review Meetings as required.
Log cases to 3rd party vendors requesting assistance on unresolved issues.
Compliance - working with the CenturyLink Client base to organise and schedule compliance items such as hardware and software updates including firmware revisions and OS and Application patching.
Good communications with customers provided throughout incident lifecycle.
Engineering and Senior Management are kept abreast of appropriate escalations.
Customer satisfaction surveys produce positive responses.
Peer level KPI's are within normal levels.

Detailed working knowledge of Microsoft Operating Systems (Windows 2008 & 2012)
Detailed knowledge of Active Directory, DNS and Microsoft Networking.
Detailed knowledge of VMware and virtual environments.
Detailed knowledge of Microsoft Clusters
Working Knowledge of one or more of the following, Citrix, Microsoft SQL, Exchange, ISA, Netbackup, SCCM.
Working knowledge of IIS and web server applications.
Working knowledge of Server monitoring
Possess analytical troubleshooting skills combined with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Be organized and be able to work under pressure
Be motivated and possess a 'can do' attitude
Proactive and energetic nature
Live within commutable distance of primary office location
Working knowledge of Server monitoring
Possess analytical troubleshooting skills combined with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:
A degree in IT, Microsoft professional qualifications or equivalent proven experience in a technical support role.
Previous experience in server maintenance and troubleshooting roles.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
The Director, Hosting Network Managed Services leads a Global organization of Managers responsible for Data Center Network Engineers. Position daily activities include performance monitoring, process capability analysis, process improvement, load management, and recruiting and retention of staff. Position manages and administers global process and procedure. This leader will work closely with Global peers and other Centurylink Business leaders to ensure client satisfaction, compliance with contractual SLA requirements, and Company objectives. This position will support our Managed Hosting Network, Application Distribution and Firewall services within hosting environments, remote client network infrastructure, and application distribution centric technologies.
Position Objectives:
Provide best-in-class levels of operational service to the Centurylink Business client base.
Develops technical strategies to transform the Data Center Network support organization to Software Defined Networking (SDN) technologies
Ensure adherence to Global policies and key Global processes. Key Global processes include but are not limited to Incident Management, Problem Management, Crisis Management, Change management and Request Management processes.
Drive continual service improvement and strategies to meet contractual obligations for our expansive client base.
Develop and enhance positive, collaborative relationships with key Global internal stakeholders.
Build and enhance relationships with strategic Global clients.
Essential Duties:
Responsible for the client experience and rapid resolution of our Hosting Network Infrastructure
Defines objectives and priorities.
Lead teams of technical professionals in infrastructure engineering roles in a 24/7 mission-critical environment.
Deals with Operational problems that are broad, complex and abstract, often involving cross functional opportunities. Must develop solutions using creativity, resourcefulness, innovation, negotiating and diplomacy.
Actively support pre-sales and service management initiatives to attract and retain valued clients.
Apply proactive customer support skills to prevent or mitigate client issues and/or concerns.
Ensure support Service Levels are measured and meet all contractual obligations and objectives.
Ensure all client contacts are conducted in a professional, positive, efficient, and quality manner.
Actively lead employee engagement, operational excellence and other cross-functional initiatives designed to enhance our client experience.
Support the career development of team members through the implementation and support of development plans.
Required skills:
Demonstrated leadership experience in an enterprise, IT or service provider environment.
Demonstrated success in a Global environment.
Outstanding client service skills and experience in written and verbal delivery as well as in remote environments (via phone and/or video)
Demonstrated success leading client support teams in a 24/7, mission-critical environment.
The ability to attract, develop and retain superior technical and managerial talent.
Ability to coordinate, orchestrate, and communicate effectively with technologists and business partners to maintain high service levels in a demanding environment
Excellent verbal, written and analytical skills
Strong analytical, diagnostic, problem solving and communication skills
Experience and training in ITIL V3
Desired skills:
Familiarization with Six Sigma, SAS-70, PCI frameworks/methodologies
Demonstrated experience with IT Process Development and/or managing complex projects to completion.
Qualified ITIL Service Manager
Education or Equivalent Experience:
12+ years of customer service experience
8+ years of management experience.
Bachelor degree or equivalent experience in a technical or service discipline
ITIL Foundation Training

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Position: Senior Network Analyst / Service Manager
Classification: Regular Full-Time
Responsible for supporting dedicated customer engagements, addressing post-sale network operations and related technical issues. Will interface with various levels of management and multiple internal work groups and organizations to lead and direct customer service improvements, resolve customer service problems and issues, and act as the primary escalation resource to the customer. Will provide a single point of contact and be accessible 24x7 when normal Project Operations fail to meet the customer‰Ûªs expectations.
Customer Care Relationship and Communication Management: Required to be an expert at identifying and utilizing resources. Must continually develop relationships within the customer base, Project Operations Team and other organizations. Will be an effective team member providing customers with a superior customer service experience through communication, coordination, and facilitation, in addition to follow up on customer satisfaction surveys.
Manage Service Level Requirements: The goal is to reduce customer network outages, time to repair, and SLR credits. Will perform real time 24X7 escalations to help facilitate timely and accurate resolution of repair issues. Will develop service improvement plans in conjunction with their customer and the Project Operations Team. Will identify process issues, Root Cause Analysis and solutions. Responsible for ensuring Project Operations Team‰Ûªs customer notification databases have current and accurate customer information at all times.
Stewardship Reporting: Works with Reporting Team to develop, analyze and distribute reports based on customer specifications. Some reports could include: Trouble History, Mean Time to Repair, % Availability, Ticket Resolution, Reason for Outages, Network Optimization, credit for Service Level Requirements details, etc. Also included are inventories, network enhancements and current organization and escalation charts.
Professional and Technical Expertise: Will maintain top professional and technical expertise at all times. Required to continually develop knowledge/expertise through self-study and training courses.
Basic Technical Qualifications:
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Engineering or a related field.
6+ Years of equivalent experience in sales engineering, engineering and/or sales, or 4+ Years with a Masters Degree.
CPE ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of M13s, fiber muxes, high end aggregation, core routers, switches, Voice CPE and their applications from local access to the enterprise and WAN environments.
WAN Protocols ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of network protocols.
Products ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of Private Line, ATM, Frame Relay, IP, ISDN, Voice Services.
Industry terminology ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of the OSI model and principles, and a solid understanding of industry terminology i.e. POPs, COs, muxing, CPE, ILEC, HiCap.
Voice/Data network design principles - A solid understanding of network design to include the components end to end. A solid understanding of voice switching technologies and equipment, PBX interconnection, 911 networks and equipment. A solid understanding of Central office based telecommunication technologies.
LEC Provisioning and Maintenance - In depth knowledge in basic processes and the management of LEC activities.
Data Services- A firm understanding IP routing protocols such as RIP, OSPF, NLSP,IGRP,EIGRP, BGP, EGP, IGP and how they are utilized and the impacts the present in the WAN environment. A firm understanding of IP addressing/sub-netting, including private address space.
Voice Services- A firm understanding of the switched and dedicated networks including VNS dial plans and basic strategies in their application within the network. A good working knowledge of inband/OOB signaling protocols, and SS7 network and routing.
Industry- IXC Provisioning and Maintenance - Able to identify all steps and processes from order entry, provisioning intervals including construction of facilities.
Network capacity planning: Inherently identify and make recommendations for capacity augments where necessary.
Trouble Isolation Procedures:
Loopbacks ‰ÛÒ Able to identify within the trouble resolution process where loopbacks are present as well as strategically placed during the fault isolation process in relation to the controlling station/CO
Test Patterns ‰ÛÒ Able to identify the test patterns utilized in guiding the trouble resolution of DS1 voice and data circuits with AMI or B8ZS line coding such as timing (3in24) B8ZS framing optioning (All zeros framed), repeater timing recovery/equalization (QRSS), repeater DC power regulation/pulse regeneration (framed all ones), alarm build out /equalizer/timing recovery
Router Commands ‰ÛÒ Able to use the basic "Show" suite of commands i.e. buffers, interface, protocols, frame, PVC, DLCI, etc in fault isolation
Non-Technical Qualifications:
Decision making, analytical, problem solving, negotiation, communications (oral, written and listening), organizational, project management, team work, and presentation skills to lead and influence customer and cross- functional teams.
Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables while maintaining strong customer focus.
Fluency with MS office product suite (EXCEL, PowerPoint).
Travel required. Must be able to travel nationally and possess a valid driver‰Ûªs license with a satisfactory driving record.
Preferred Qualifications:
CenturyLink Tools/Systems - applicable based on the product suite the customer base supports.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. Job Responsibilities:
Responsible for the provisioning and maintenance of Central Office including, but not limited to subscriber loop carrier systems, DSL, POTS, digital and optical muxes, and GPON.
Installs, performs routine maintenance, analyzes defects, tests, adjusts, repairs and maintains complex equipment such as switching systems, circuit equipment, network terminal equipment, and data/digital equipment by using electrical and or electronic measuring devices.
Updates work and maintenance logs through WFA, Word.docs and FOMS databases.
Plans jobs and determines materials and resources needed to complete tasks.
Reviews and interprets work orders, wiring lists, wiring diagrams, and equipment drawings and follows standard practices in the performance of job duties..
Runs diagnostic test programs, analyzes defects, performs routine maintenance and/or tests various types of telephone switching equipment (5ESS) (DMS 100)
Uses various types of testing devices, e.g. volt-ohm meters, spectrum analyzer, digital communications, data analyzers, etc.
Works varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, and/or callouts, weekends and holidays.
Keeps work team and managers informed of status on work tasks, projects, and problems or obstacles.
Basic Job Qualifications:
At least six (6) months experience within the last five (5) years diagnosing circuit trouble, and performing routine testing, including measuring AC/DC current using volt ohm meters, TMS, or comparable test equipment.
At least six (6) months experience within the last five (5) years provisioning and maintaining DSO, DS1/T1, DS3/T3, GPON, DSL and ISDN circuits or services.
Basic electricity knowledge as it relates to telecommunications (through classes or on the job related training) including: reading & interpreting circuit diagrams, equipment drawings, & technical manuals.
Working knowledge of hand and power tools.
Working knowledge of analog, digital test and transmission equipment, volt-ohm meter, or comparable testing equipment.
Working knowledge of Sonnet/DWDM equipment and services (e.g. DCS and optical muxes).
Ability to troubleshoot and isolate problems within physical or electrical circuits.
Ability to respond to callouts within reasonable timeframe.
Willing to submit to a Federal background check
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to lifting and/or moving up to 100 pounds.
May require travel between Central Office locations.
Requires a valid state drivers‰Ûª license with current satisfactory driving record.
Ability to work in confined spaces (e.g. attics, crawl spaces, utility holes).
Ability to work aloft (e.g. ladder).
Ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over the phone.
Ability to multi task under pressure in an ever changing environment.
Successful completion and passage of all applicable employment testing and interview.
Ability to work varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, weekends and holidays.
PREFERRED Job Qualifications:
At least 12 months experience within the last five (5) years diagnosing circuit trouble, and performing routine testing, including measuring AC/DC current using volt ohm meters, TDR, or comparable test equipment.
At least 12 months experience within the last five (5) years provisioning and maintaining DSO, DS1/T1, DS3/T3, GPON, DSL and ISDN circuits or services.
At least 12 months experience within the last five (5) years maintaining 5ESS and DMS 100 switches.
At least 6 months experience within the last five (5) years running diagnostic test programs, analyzes defects and/or tests using various types of testing devices.
Experience working in teams or alone problem solving, diagnosing, and repairing maintenance conditions in Central Office equipment.
Ability to diagnose circuit trouble, and perform routine testing, including measuring current (and loss), balance, power influence, and noise levels.
Experience in working on a computer in Windows based systems and Microsoft Outlook.
Experience working independently with little supervision.
Experience meeting work deadlines.
Other Job Requirements:
Selected candidate is required to remain in the position for a minimum of 30 months (Time in Title) and 18 months (Time in Location).

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES ( Position Expectations )
Responsible for contributing to engagements associated with either model development or model validation for major financial services clients, primarily banking.
Model Development responsibilities include:
Selection and deployment of appropriate statistical methodologies and tools in consultation with the client
Managing model development with a mix of hands-on development and some support of Consultant/Sr. Consultant resources.
Review all work product prior to discussion with client
Co-author/oversee creation of documentation consistent with client‰Ûªs internal standards and regulatory guidance
Escalate issues to Director + as needed
Model Validation responsibilities include:
Responsible for evaluating risks associated with the client company's models, such as defaults, loss given default, valuation, attrition, scoring and others.
Assess model risks by performing detailed model validation reviews, establishing performance thresholds, researching model approaches, recommending alternative models and other approaches.
Directly contribute to a variety of validation activities, including review of model design, data review, model policy adherence and appropriate usage.
Make expert recommendations to Client Management about proposed new models or model changes.
Document findings to model owners and management, and propose remediation plans to address issues appropriately.
Additionally, candidates should have the ability to develop new methodologies building on existing intellectual capital and integrating them with partner offerings and existing systems on the client side.
Creative problem-solving skills and flexibility and persistence in working with others (including non-techies on the client side) are key in this role.
REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
The ideal candidate will have a wide range of experience analyzing and deriving insights from data.
Experience in building and validating predictive models using techniques like logistic regression, time series, survival analysis, non-linear regression, neural networks, dynamic Bayesian networks, etc.
He/she will be good at translating complex technical concepts into actionable tactical and strategic insights and communicating them persuasively to our internal teams and managers as well as clients and partners.
7-10+ years in Model Development in banking industry, with explicit experience building and/or validating models under a formal governance structure.
Technical/Business Skills
Demonstrated experience managing small projects (up to 3 FTE for 3-6 months) --> requirements through delivery
Strong experience using multiple statistical packages (SAS and R preferred)
Ability to quickly learn and apply new tools as needed
Consulting Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills ‰ÛÒ can assist in creating PowerPoint decks, Statements of Work and formal documentation of results
Strong client facing skills ‰ÛÒ able to represent Cognilytics professionally and deepen client relationships
Demonstrated organization and planning skills; ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Excellent problem solving abilities
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work in a team environment
Experience providing project status reports, metrics, etc.; experience addressing any personnel, delivery or other issues that may arise in an engagement
EDUCATION
Masters/PhD in Statistics/Econometrics/Machine Learning or other quantitative discipline

CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Responsibilities:
‰Û¢The IT Solutions Sales Consultant will drive new IT Services revenue by selling directly to business customers and providing IT consulting sales support to account managers in an assigned territory or customer base. They will uncover new opportunities to penetrate new accounts and grow existing accounts within the assigned territory. They will perform consultative, solutions-based design for business clients and will be responsible for matching a client‰Ûªs business roadmap with a technical vision by identifying opportunities, solving business challenges and driving complex deployments. As a technical consulting expert and authority within the industry, the IT Solutions Sales Consultant applies leadership and advice on multiple technologies that help develop industry solutions that shape clients technical vision and strategies to provide strategic solutions that will meet business challenges.
‰Û¢Prospect on a continual basis to Identify, qualify and close high quality new business by leading account planning efforts and developing strategic account plans.
‰Û¢Directly sell and/or lead pursuit team to qualify deals.
‰Û¢Functions as the sales architect who can identify and work with Principal Consulting Engineer to develop solutions and design at the Statement of Work (SOW) level.
‰Û¢Demonstrates expertise in the practice areas and works as the lead technical sales member of the account team for IT Services, be able to identify, qualify, design, develop and present solutions based upon customer's business requirements.
‰Û¢Must have the experience to understand the various ways a solution may be delivered and can anticipate what will work best for a given client. By combining technical expertise with business acumen you will provide vital, detailed information about how CenturyLink‰Ûªs solutions deliver business value to our clients.
‰Û¢Analyze needs of the Sales team and create supporting documentation or tools to better equip the team in the sales process.
‰Û¢Share knowledge and experience to enhance the technical capabilities of peers and build prospective opportunities.
‰Û¢Work with account teams to develop scopes of work and respond to IT Solutions RFPs as needed.
‰Û¢Possess solid understanding of the competitive landscape and ability to clearly articulate the differentiation and value proposition of CenturyLink IT Solutions versus the competitors.
‰Û¢Build and deliver creative value-added solutions (leveraging internal and external / partner talent where applicable). The position involves selling, in a direct sales and/or overlay environment. The responsibilities include pre-sales analysis of customer requirements, determination of integration requirements to existing customer systems, and presentation of customer solutions. Additionally, provide in depth sales support for IT Services and Practice areas as part of the overall customer solution.
‰Û¢The ability to work in a team environment and to collaborate on the development of innovative, tailored solutions for clients and prospects. This is primarily a presales technical position with the added opportunities to provide fee-based assessment, consulting, & design services as well as hands-on implementation work if appropriate to the ITSSC‰Ûªs skill set, experience, and customer requirements
‰Û¢Work closely with Project Teams to maximize client satisfaction.
‰Û¢Develop key relationships with clients at an executive level to advance the sale or to further develop the revenue stream associated with the account. Leverage those relationships to expand business through a consultative selling approach.
‰Û¢Use CRM (Sales Force) and knowledge management tools in order to provide various levels of reports for top opportunities, weekly progress reports, monthly business activities, accurate forecasts, updates, account review documentation, update to sales forecast well as ad hoc report requests.
Basic Qualifications:
‰Û¢At least 8 ‰ÛÒ 12 years‰Ûª experience working in the IT Services industry with business and IT knowledge specializing in Application Development and Maintenance, Testing and QA services, as well as Strategic Consulting solutions. Person should be considered Subject Matter Expert.
‰Û¢Experience in Information Technology Outsourcing (Application Development, Application Management) sales and ability to cross sell IT services.
‰Û¢Understanding of the sales process. Demonstrated experience selling and delivering solutions-based services (not just staffing), as well as ability to cross-sell services.
‰Û¢Strong oral and written communications skills and must possess experience presenting and leading meetings with senior executives including C-level suite. Proven ability to develop relationships with senior client executives and leverage those relationships.
‰Û¢Strong background in project work, including project estimation, sales support and proposal writing, as well as forecasting.
‰Û¢Understand diverse business units and develop / drive strategic initiatives, value propositions and compelling proposals.
‰Û¢Ability to document solution components in a timely manner while ensuring acceptable level of detail, data integrity, and accountability,
‰Û¢Ability and willingness to share knowledge and expertise among various organizations within the company,
‰Û¢Leadership experience with a demonstrated ability to build and motivate distributed and global teams. Ability and willingness to take the initiative to facilitate teamwork within the various organizations of the company to serve the customer,
‰Û¢Ability to work in a team environment, lead a pursuit team and demonstrate strong problem solving skills,
‰Û¢Capability to schedule time with flexibility to handle varying workload, and still meet tight deadlines,
‰Û¢Ability to multi-task and work multiple projects simultaneously
‰Û¢One core technology area of expertise ( Technology or Infrastructure Domains)
‰Û¢Valid Driver's License and Satisfactory Driving Record
‰Û¢Ability to travel as needed
Preferred Qualifications:
‰Û¢Desired Specialty Background ‰ÛÒ IT Outsourcing sales with strong technical understanding of IT services.
‰Û¢7 to 10 or more years of industry experience working in design, implementation and management of global enterprise network systems for a service integrator, global management consulting, technology services, or outsourcing company
‰Û¢7 or more years of technical background in telecommunications, IT and/or the service provider industry
‰Û¢Well versed in enterprise architecture/IT Strategies
‰Û¢Broad understanding of IT Planning, architecting, engineering, and operations across multiple disciplines
‰Û¢Strong relationship building skills to effectively work in all areas of the business to successfully perform the required duties.
‰Û¢Experience developing relationships with senior client executives
‰Û¢Process a strong business acumen and aptitude to understand the key business drivers and financial knowledge to develop return on investment models
Alternate Location: Charlotte, NC (North Carolina)
Company Statement
CenturyLink is an industry-leading provider of communications, high speed Internet and entertainment services from coast to coast. Our combination of business and residential service solutions ‰ÛÒ including home and wireless voice solutions and digital television ‰ÛÒ provide innovative solutions to our customers. CenturyLink is proud to be a participant in the U.S. General Services Administration Networx program, the largest communications services contract in the world. CenturyLink offers you the opportunity to develop and cultivate your career as we lead the communications industry into the future.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
The Centurylink Service Technician serving the Windsor, MO service area will be installing telephone plant facilities and high-speed internet at customer premises according to specifications directed and established by CenturyLink procedures. This includes maintaining, expanding, replacing and repairing all plant facilities and subscriber apparatus required to provide service to customers. The Service Technician interacts directly with CenturyLink customers and support sales efforts through iLead.
The position requires Technical proficiency to perform the specific work requirements of the job in the particular location.
The Service Tech responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Strive for satisfactory customer service by performing such duties as: cable maintenance, installation, removal, rearrangement and maintenance of single line and associated apparatus equipment, up to and including cross connection to the switching equipment; single & multi channel subscriber carrier systems; performs other related duties.
Build span lines, installing repeaters or doublers and performing tag and test functions on cable pairs to meet HDSL requirements.
Observe all safety rules and regulations.
Assist other Technical personnel in the performance of their duties when requested.
Convey a positive and professional appearance and demeanor when communicating the company‰Ûªs products and services to our customers.
Actively support sales and marketing related activities
Assume all other duties as assigned.
Note: Attendance, conduct, and performance records will be considered in the selection process. The selection process for this position is governed by a collective bargaining agreement.
Requirements
Education: High School Diploma or GED.
Experience: One year of current telecommunications industry experience in one or more of the following areas: installation, maintenance, and repair of aerial, buried and underground wire and cable; telephones; switched digital television; High Speed Internet; building wiring; station equipment; or equivalent in education and training.
Experience with performing transmission and noise measurements and making corrective adjustments to equipment.
Ability to interpret work prints, service orders and drawings; work from oral or written instructions, plan work and work without direct supervision and repair technical problems with minimum supervision.
Knowledge or able to acquire: Power system and its operators, digital data communication, long loop line treat requirements, carrier and span line maintenance, "Special Service" equipment install and maintenance, central office "controlled maintenance" procedures and records, and fiber optic terminal equipment.
Ability to safely use hooks, ladders, bucket trucks; and to climb poles.
Ability to distinguish colors on facilities.
Ability to lift heavy objects as required.
Ability to work in confined spaces.
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions and at various hours of the day/night.
Ability to respond to after hour call-outs, work overtime, shift, weekends, and holidays as required.
Ability to travel overnight as necessary for business requirements and training.
Possession of a valid State driver‰Ûªs license with ability to safely operate company vehicles and equipment, and maintain a safe driving record.
Ability to maintain an excellent attendance record.
Ability to reside within certain proximity of a reporting location
Preferred Qualifications
Associate‰Ûªs Degree in Electronics/Communications or equivalent work experience.
CCNT, CCNA, Network+, or A+ Certifications.
Training on basic IT and network fundamentals.
Experience in Outside Plant functions.
Subscriber carrier training.
Pole climbing training.
Experience or training in how to read and interpret outside and subscriber plant facility records.
Internet protocol telephony exposure.
Electronics training or experience that demonstrates knowledge of AC/DC theory.
Experience splicing fiber optics.
Knowledge of analog and digital transmission.
Experience with installation and troubleshooting of high-speed internet services.
Proven ability to generate sales opportunities during day-to-day customer contact.
Alternate Location: US-Missouri-Windsor

Internal Candidates must meet Time in Title/Location requirements of their current position for consideration.
Job Responsibilities:
Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried ,underground, aerial and work locations.
Uses heavy-duty power equipment (e.g., compressors, pumps, blowers), hand tools, power tools (air and electric), and specialty tools, including electric and electronic measuring devices (e.g., multi-meters, volt-ohm meters), in the construction and repair of outside plant facilities.
Performs testing and turn-up of subscriber lines, carrier plant, and/or fiber optic plant.
Locates and repairs air leaks in aerial, underground, and/or buried cable.
Locates, joins, repairs and rearranges cable and cable conductors in buildings and aerial or buried plant.
Installs, maintains/repairs, and tests residential/small business telecommunication service (POTS and DSL) HSI.
Connects wires and cables to terminals, and attaches/detaches various kinds of hardware to wires, cables and buildings.
Performs continuity and/or conformance testing.
Reads and interprets customer service orders, technical (i.e., mechanical, electrical, digital) drawings, maps, blueprints, diagrams, etc.

Works with telecom color-coded wires and cables
Basic Qualifications
Knowledge of basic electricity, as it relates to telecommunications (through classes or on-the-job training), which includes: knowledge related to the basic principles, theories, and applications of electricity (e.g., voltage, current, resistance, power, grounding, insulation, Ohm‰Ûªs Law, AC/DC); knowledge of basic electrical components (e.g., conductors, insulators, switches, capacitors, inductors, transformers) and basic circuit design; and knowledge of the operation and application of common electrical components and common measurement instruments (e.g., multi-meters, etc.).
Working knowledge of test equipment (e.g., Tech Tad, Sidekick, 965DSP, transmission measuring sets).
Ability to use established electrical, digital, and/or mechanical principals and to perform appropriate tests to identify and solve problems encountered on the job.
Ability to efficiently and accurately work with multiple types of information and/or perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to complete designated amount of work in a specified timeframe (e.g., quality jobs per day), adjusting work assignments or schedules to meet changing work-related priorities or demands.
Ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over-the-phone.
Ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and to foster a cooperative climate, as well as to work independently in the field with little supervision.
Ability to climb and work at elevations up to 18 feet.
Ability to work in confined spaces (e.g., attics, crawl spaces, utility holes).
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to: lifting objects weighing up to 75 pounds.
Ability to perform job activities outdoors in different weather conditions (e.g., extreme cold and/or heat, inclement weather).
A valid State driver‰Ûªs license with a current satisfactory driving record.
Ability to work varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, weekends and holidays.
PREFERRED Job Qualifications:
At least 6 months experience within the last five years maintaining/repairing and testing copper and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
At least 6 months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
General experience in testing and turning up DSL, and Carrier Systems.
Ability to read, review, interpret and understand technical documents (e.g., schematics, drawings, blueprints, layouts).
Prior Customer Service experience.
Ability to recognize and identify sales opportunities that meet the needs of customers and the company, including promoting and closing sales of products and services.
Prior experience working on a computer in a Windows-based system and with Microsoft Outlook.
Prior experience using a body belt and safety straps.

Senior Sales Engineer
Location: Brookfield, WI
Job Description:
The Sr Sales Engineer is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements discovery, telecommunications and CPE solution design/engineering/consulting, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink's full suite of products and solutions. Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions. Alters the design as needed to result in the customer choosing CenturyLink Solutions including Managed Hosting Services, Cloud Virtualization, Outsourced Infrastructure Solutions (managed and un-managed), and specialized Enterprise application suites. Pre-sales design and implementation expertise in CPE an Enterprise/WAN service integrations. Documents, via diagrams and writing, and presents the solution to the customer, describes the benefits of the solution and build relationships with customers. Participates in strategic and tactical account planning. Follows industry technology trends through self-study and formal training and shares that knowledge with customers. Understands power, cooling and other environmental constraints on a client's outsourced infrastructure. Clearly communicates the customer design to the teams responsible for ordering, implementation and ongoing support. Provides technical training and development support to the local branch. Leads internal cross-functional teams to obtain required approvals of non-standard designs for customers. Performs customer discover discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions. Creatively designs solutions for customers using the best mix of CenturyLink and vendor-partner products. Builds relationships with customers by serving as the technical liaison for pre-sales to post-sales, with the goal of being the customer's trusted advisor. Responsible for growing strategic product sales and revenue through proactive engagement with customers. Participates in strategic and tactical account planning. A good candidate has a strong technical background in layers 1 through 3 of the OSI model and knowledge of the characteristics of various applications that ride over data networks (i.e. the performance requirements of packetized voice and video and of various data applications), who has a desire to sell and who is comfortable looking for opportunities once introduced to a customer.
Specific skills and knowledge needed to be effective include:
Business and technical requirements discovery; ability to craft a solution based on those requirements.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong presentation skills.
Technical knowledge:
Customer premises communication (data, video, voice) equipment from major vendors; IP routing and switching; Internet and MPLS-VPN architecture; Voice and VoIP technologies and products; TDM, SONET and Ethernet technologies and products; Data center infrastructure and networking.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field and/or 3-5 years of equivalent in sales engineering, systems engineering (Cloud, Hosting, Managed Services, Networking Services, Telephony, IP Networking Equipment), and/or sales.
Strong knowledge of internetworking designs and their applications, to include Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced Infrastructure Solutions (managed and unmanaged), Specialized Enterprise Application Suites, IP Subnetting and Complex Routing Techniques on LAN/WAN networks, IP Telephony, Security, Network Diversity Applications and other technical skills documented above.
Consultative selling and customer questioning techniques in order to identify new opportunities to sell within existing accounts and maintain the role of trusted advisor to both the customer and the sales team.
Effective presentation, analytical, communications and customer relationship skills.
Industry leading certifications preferred (Cisco, Juniper and others).
Proficiency with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio, Netformix is a plus.
Strong project management skills.
Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables.
Time management skills are a critical requirement.
Must have a valid Driver's License with satisfactory driving record.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge / experience with hosted voice systems, especially Broadsoft or Metaswitch.

The Manager, Data Center Facilities provides day-to-day oversight and leadership of CenturyLink operated data center facilities. Responsibilities include maintenance, repair, installation and operation of the facility as it pertains to electrical systems, mechanical systems, capacity planning, project management, customer build-outs, and all other aspects of data center facility operation. The Manager, Data Facilities is responsible for managing 24/7 activities of Facilities Team while working in collaboration with Network Operations, Global Engineering and various other internal and external customers.
Position Objectives:
Provide leadership to the local Data Center Facilities team with a broad set of responsibilities; manage tactical and strategic activities with focus on continuous improvement.
Operates and maintains data center to assure 100% uptime to customers.
Ensures that data centers comply with all local, state, and federal health and safety requirements.
Operates data center equipment to obtain maximum effectiveness and efficiency (safety, cost, equipment longevity, and reliability).
Works with Sales, Service Delivery and Customers to provide successful build implementations within specified timelines.
Participates in all Change Management processes including risk assessment and procedural development and review.
Works closely with the Global Engineering team in problem resolution and trending.
Manages raised-floor capacity, power and cooling in data centers, maximizing revenue space for installed products.
Essential Duties:
Managing operations and maintenance of all data center infrastructure equipment (critical and non-critical)
Managing facilities training program and overall staff development.
Schedule and supervise the performance of both routine maintenance and emergency service on critical systems, including: diesel generators, UPS systems, electrical switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, HVAC equipment, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
Management of critical infrastructure improvement projects.
Development and management of facilities budget for maintenance, repairs, capital and general operating costs; bottom-up development of yearly budgets.
Responsibility and oversight for customer implementations, including review and approval of proposed Service Level Agreements and Contract changes.
Manage local facilities team
Manage all facilities documentation (planning, development, and implementation)
Coordination with all other groups (sales, NOC, network, finance, executive staff)
Negotiation and approval of vendor contracts/agreements
On-call 24x7 for incident management and data center emergency response.
Responsible for site safety and environmental compliance.
Required Skills:
Strong management and leadership skills.
Extensive knowledge of data center critical systems, including: diesel generators, UPS systems, fuel systems, switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, computer room air handlers, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
Must have the ability to make solid business decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Candidate must display confidence in client-facing situations.
Team player with excellent consultative and communication skills and the proven ability to work effectively with internal and external clients, vendors and consultants.
Education or Equivalent Experience:
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
5-10 years of facilities experience in mission critical environments with 3 years in a supervisory/management role.
CFM or equivalent facilities management certification desired.
Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical) or equivalent.
