Recommend new security policy, standards, best practices, and system configuration standards. Consult with internal clients on security topics and policy interpretation.

Coordinate activities across multiple departments and business units.

Strong oral and written communication skills and comfort with presenting technical issues to all levels of management, as well as non-technical staff.

Must possess broad technical knowledge of current and emerging technologies used both within the corporate infrastructure and in delivering customer facing services.

Installs tests and maintains private and switched services, and applications for individual residential and business customers. Such services and applications include analog, data, sub-rate and high speed digital, DSL, VDSL, ISDN, E911, 911, audio and video services, and associated ancillary equipment and software configured to meet existing and anticipated customer needs. Requirements include work on both copper and fiber facilities and equipment for DSO, DS1, DS3 & above, and optical circuits.
Uses laptop computer to option electronic systems and applications, and to test and install individual services. Installs computer interface cards in customer owned equipment (laptop and desktop computers).
Successfully options/configures customer‰Ûªs computer hardware and software, installs modems and telephone filters and applications to complete DSL and VDSL services.
Reviews, analyzes, updates, and interprets work orders, circuit diagrams, word documents, schematic drawings, engineering work prints, OSP (Outside Plant) maps, equipment drawings, company records, technical manuals and other source documents to obtain specifications for installation and trouble isolation purposes.
Follows standard practices.
Resolves issues to insure service is installed/repaired by committed date/time.

Conducts tests associated with the installation and repair of individual circuits. Resolves customer issues and problems, insures customer satisfaction; insures service is working to specifications. Contacts control and/or dispatch centers or other designated employees during tour for other assignments.
Analyzes service orders and trouble tickets for accuracy and completeness, verifies critical dates, commitments, facility and equipment assignments, reasonableness of test results and conformity of circuits to established tolerance criteria.
Utilizes various testing devices such as frequency and data signal generators, transmission measuring sets, volt-ohm-meters, software programs, while installing and maintaining equipment, services and applications. Uses test equipment and/or coordinates testing of customer lines with others including company and customer personnel, as well as with the assistance of the control and/or dispatch centers.
Performs pre-survey to determine availability of equipment and facilities, to pretest circuits to ensure that conditioning requirements are met, and to review with customer work specified in the work order and the possibilities of utilizing existing facilities for upgrading/customizing services.
Repairs, maintains, splices and performs conformance testing of subscriber line, carrier‰Ûªs plant and/or fiber optic plant.
When installing or repairing telephone services, connects equipment to inside cable and makes cross connections by connecting color coded wires.
Joins repairs and rearranges cable conductors in utility holes.
Makes necessary test for gas before entering utility hole.
Must pump water and/or clean debris from utility hole. Locates, joins, repairs and rearranges cable and cable conductors in building and aerial or buried plant.
Places, rearranges and/or removes all forms of outside plant, including but not limited to : underground cable, buried cable, conduit, aerial cable, fiber optics, inside wiring cable, intra-system cable, submarine cable, aerial wire, station wire and all associated hardware and equipment including carrier and fiber optic terminal equipment.
Performs trouble isolation of transport customer and company communications components, cable and infrastructure form the customer‰Ûª s premise up to and including the central office/loop runner equipment.
Runs cross-connects, check batteries to alarms and repairs equipment in SLC/HUT locations.
Installs, performs routine maintenance, analyzes defects, tests, adjusts, repairs and provide timely customer service.
All other duties as assigned.
Other Requirements of Job:
Work shifts are determined by seniority and may include pager duty, weekends, and late or overnight shifts.
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to lifting and/or moving up to 100 pounds.
Experience in using a body belt and safety straps.
Requires state drivers license and current satisfactory driving record.
Work Environment:
Works outside in all weather conditions.
Works inside customer businesses.
Works in confined spaces including controlled environment vaults and utility holes.

Previous experience in provisioning, installing, and Maintaining E911/911, DS0/DS1/DS3 and above circuits.
Previous experience conducting tests associated with the installation, repair, turn-up of T1 and HDSL spans for Hi-Cap and T1 Circuits. Copper and fiber outside plant.

The successful candidate will be capable of meeting demands for timely customer facing feedback on on-going escalated issues, root cause reports and will drive internal technical teams towards the effective and efficient operations activities as assigned by regional or global mgmt. They will provide superior support to Client environment in a complex network and/or hosting solutions architecture and to any network product in CenturyLink. The ideal candidate will have extensive operational experience in various systems and environment, and will have a broad understanding of networking technologies which support it.
Position Objectives:
Deliver superior customer service through professional, comprehensive, and timely communication for all Incidents and Requests for Change
Ensure timely response, escalation, and resolution to promote the rapid restoration of services for all incidents
Through review and approval, ensure methodical and successful execution of customer change requests
Maintain system stability through advanced troubleshooting, timely resolution of customer incidents, and proactive maintenance
Maintain and improve client loyalty and Net Promoter scores
Partner with the Account and Sales team and aid in the regular Service Reviews. Work with the Account team to built a strong client relationship and grown revenue
Communicating and collaborating with local and global teams.
Essential Duties:
Identify, resolve, and/or escalate hosting issues according to procedural documentation and training
Creative problem-solving to identify the source of problems
Create or update documentation including network diagrams, procedures, and policies to ensure consistent support of customer environments
Through customer consultation, realize growth opportunities for production customer environments.
Provide guidance to adjacent support tiers to assist in resolution of complex network, system and security incidents
Provide and obtain timely updates to/from relevant parties (internal and external)
Partner with the Problem Management Centre to reduce re-occurring incidents
Provide consultative assistance to the Operations Centre during off hours as needed
Review system and network configurations with Service Delivery to ensure successful implementation of services into production
Perform incident trend analysis to promote a stable solution within the environment.
Participate in mandatory meeting and training sessions
Other duties as assigned
Essential Skills:
Email and Phone based communications in both Japanese and English
Reading and Writing in both Japanese and English
Previous Operating Systems support experience in enterprise, IT or service provider environment
Hands on experience with the following:
Support and analysis of firewall and security technologies (IDS,IPS,WAF)
Virtual and physical security technologies (ie. Cisco ACE/FWSM, ASA, IP tables, ACL, Fortigate, etc.)
Layer 2 and 3 networking technologies (Cisco 6500 series & Juniper devices) as well as configuring and troubleshooting VRFs and VLANs.
Expertise with MPLS (Multiprotocol Label Switching)
Expertise with the following protocols
Routing Protocols (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, RIP)
Multicast protocols (PIM, IGMP, MVPN)
Support expertise of System Load balancers (F5, Cisco ACE, A10)
A commitment to delivering a superior customer experience through direct interaction with customers during support and change management
Technical certifications in areas of expertise (Cisco, Juniper, Nortel)
Ability to quickly adapt to advancing technologies and procedural changes
Proven incident and problem solving (troubleshooting) skills with an emphasis on a timely resolution
Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively with other technologists and business partners to maintain high service levels in a demanding environment
Ability to work well in team environment
Excellent verbal, written and analytical skills in Japanese and English
Desired skills:
Familiarity with:
Linux Systems (Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6 and 7, Solaris 10)
Windows Server Systems (Windows 2003 /2008 /2012)
Knowledge of Shell scripting/Perl/Expect/Powershell and/or other scripting languages.
Hardware and firmware exposure in a physical systems environments (HP, IBM, Sun)
Database administration
Familiarization with ITIL guidelines and practices
Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies
Project Management experience
Wide Area Network
ISP router (CIENA)
Experience diagnosing complex issues through packet capture analysis (Wireshark, tcpdump, snoop, Sniffer Pro)
Education or Equivalent Experience:
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree or equivalent education in related fields
Certificates of training in associated fields/equipment (CCNA/CCNP/Juniper)
Minimum 6-8 years of experience in related IT Field.
N.B.

As a Centurylink Network Technician Installation and Maintenance in Grand Forks, ND, you will be responsible for all aspects of cable repair and maintenance. Job Responsibilities:
Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried ,underground, aerial and work locations.
Uses heavy-duty power equipment (e.g., compressors, pumps, blowers), hand tools, power tools (air and electric), and specialty tools, including electric and electronic measuring devices (e.g., multi-meters, volt-ohm meters), in the construction and repair of outside plant facilities.

Locates, joins, repairs and rearranges cable and cable conductors in buildings and aerial or buried plant.

LEAD STORAGE ENGINEER
The Lead Storage Engineer is responsible for designing, documenting, and maintaining SAN/NAS technologies. An emphasis is placed on delivering highly scalable, cost effective, and high performing designs. The storage engineer will participate in cross functional collaboration requiring frequent and clear communications with supporting teams.

Participate in projects to deploy, expand, and update the storage technology infrastructure
Create and maintain operational documentation

Serve in an ownership role along with other team members to continuously improve services, streamline internal processes, and maximize infrastructure effectiveness

Uses advanced techniques to analyze, define and document customer needs and required functionality.

Primary technical interface to external stakeholders
Ensures technical teams execute to deliver quality and meet deadlines

Cloud technology

Strong troubleshooting skills and able to work with other team members effectively
Ability to work with a global team as well as independently with minimal supervision to achieve project milestones and deadlines
Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to various audiences with clarity and confidence
Familiarity with ITIL concepts and best practices
Must be self-motivated, driven for success and carry a desire for personal and corporate growth
IA Certification: Security +

Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried ,underground, aerial and work locations.

Senior Sales Engineer
Location: Minneapolis, MN
Job Description:
The Sr Sales Engineer is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements discovery, telecommunications and CPE solution design/engineering/consulting, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink's full suite of products and solutions. Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions. Alters the design as needed to result in the customer choosing CenturyLink Solutions including Managed Hosting Services, Cloud Virtualization, Outsourced Infrastructure Solutions (managed and un-managed), and specialized Enterprise application suites. Pre-sales design and implementation expertise in CPE an Enterprise/WAN service integrations. Documents, via diagrams and writing, and presents the solution to the customer, describes the benefits of the solution and build relationships with customers. Participates in strategic and tactical account planning. Follows industry technology trends through self-study and formal training and shares that knowledge with customers. Understands power, cooling and other environmental constraints on a client's outsourced infrastructure. Clearly communicates the customer design to the teams responsible for ordering, implementation and ongoing support. Provides technical training and development support to the local branch. Leads internal cross-functional teams to obtain required approvals of non-standard designs for customers. Performs customer discover discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal solutions. Creatively designs solutions for customers using the best mix of CenturyLink and vendor-partner products. Builds relationships with customers by serving as the technical liaison for pre-sales to post-sales, with the goal of being the customer's trusted advisor. Responsible for growing strategic product sales and revenue through proactive engagement with customers. Participates in strategic and tactical account planning. A good candidate has a strong technical background in layers 1 through 3 of the OSI model and knowledge of the characteristics of various applications that ride over data networks (i.e. the performance requirements of packetized voice and video and of various data applications), who has a desire to sell and who is comfortable looking for opportunities once introduced to a customer.
Specific skills and knowledge needed to be effective include:
Business and technical requirements discovery; ability to craft a solution based on those requirements.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong presentation skills.
Technical knowledge:
Customer premises communication (data, video, voice) equipment from major vendors; IP routing and switching; Internet and MPLS-VPN architecture; Voice and VoIP technologies and products; TDM, SONET and Ethernet technologies and products; Data center infrastructure and networking.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field and/or 3-5 years of equivalent in sales engineering, systems engineering (Cloud, Hosting, Managed Services, Networking Services, Telephony, IP Networking Equipment), and/or sales.
Strong knowledge of internetworking designs and their applications, to include Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced Infrastructure Solutions (managed and unmanaged), Specialized Enterprise Application Suites, IP Subnetting and Complex Routing Techniques on LAN/WAN networks, IP Telephony, Security, Network Diversity Applications and other technical skills documented above.
Consultative selling and customer questioning techniques in order to identify new opportunities to sell within existing accounts and maintain the role of trusted advisor to both the customer and the sales team.
Effective presentation, analytical, communications and customer relationship skills.
Industry leading certifications preferred (Cisco, Juniper and others).
Proficiency with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio, Netformix is a plus.
Strong project management skills.
Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables.
Time management skills are a critical requirement.
Must have a valid Driver's License with satisfactory driving record.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge / experience with hosted voice systems, especially Broadsoft or Metaswitch.

jobs_title: SR LEAD IT ENGINEER (Senior Platform Integration Engineer)
jobs_requirement:
CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Position Overview:
The CenturyLink Platform Development Center, based in Bellevue, Washington, is the epicenter of service automation for CenturyLink. Our mission is to provide world-class information technology services to global businesses on virtual, dedicated and physical infrastructure using a common provisioning user experience. We call this Platform CenturyLink.
The Platform Enablement team sits within the Platform Development Center, and is focused on the business strategies that help achieve a true ‰ÛÏplatform‰Ûù effect around CenturyLink. This means engaging with the technology, software, service and startup communities to motivate investment that drives effectiveness of the customer ecosystem. The Platform Enablement team is broadly responsible for user success, evangelizing our platform to the market, and recruiting new partners to our environment, as well as supporting those stakeholders with the metrics necessary to drive insight.
Within the Cloud Platform team, the Senior Platform Integration Engineer will be responsible for execution of ecosystem programs that result in the most compelling business agility marketplace in the industry. This resource will be responsible for growing the number of companies that integrate their intellectual property with our cloud, increasing the effectiveness of the CenturyLink Cloud Marketplace.
About Platform CenturyLink:
Just like everyone else, we want to hire unbelievably bright people, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Let‰Ûªs not forget that they also have to love to learn new technology. Our team members should have a passion for ensuring our services and solutions are effective and that we are solving problems for our customers. A team member limiting themselves to a narrowly-focused job description would be unthinkable for this kind of user-facing role. We hope that you are comfortable doing everything from listening to customers, identifying risk, assisting with documentation, representing the platform, and driving user satisfaction.
Platform CenturyLink is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Business organization. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused DevOps culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity. We build the cloud, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run. Every day, all the time. It‰Ûªs what we do. CenturyLink offers competitive salaries and benefits.
Position Objectives:
‰Û¢ Drive an increase in the number of ecosystem partners
‰Û¢ Shape the feature roadmap for the cloud platform around points of integration
‰Û¢ Increase effectiveness of the cloud marketplace
‰Û¢ Support incentive structure to ensure continued partner investment
‰Û¢ Make technology partners successful as the go-to-market around CenturyLink‰Ûªs platform
‰Û¢ Build engagement between ecosystem partners and prospective users
‰Û¢ Create a sense of community within ecosystem members
Essential Duties:
‰Û¢ Focus on onboarding partners to the technical elements of the platform (API, orchestration, catalog, billing, etc)
‰Û¢ Identifying target software partners and the networks which enhance their value.
‰Û¢ Technical support of recruiting and on-boarding ecosystem partners
‰Û¢ Building repeatable, scalable technical programs to integrate partners and networks into the CenturyLink
‰Û¢ Collaborate as a member of the Cloud Platform leadership team to refine strategic priorities for the platform
‰Û¢ Work with the Product Ownership team to develop feature backlog around marketplace, orchestration and API - ensuring the product definition supports the best possible ecosystem experience while maximizing BU revenue metrics.
‰Û¢ Interface with Marketing and the Cloud Commercialization organization around go-to-market mechanics for ecosystem partners
‰Û¢ Develop relationships with partner executives to ensure alignment, gather feedback and continually improve their return on investment with CenturyLink Cloud.
‰Û¢ Act as a key technical resource to sales engineers, channel managers, marketing specialists and partner managers.
‰Û¢ Participates in industry/product functions, seminars and round tables to remain up to date on industry or product knowledge.
‰Û¢ Other duties as assigned by management
Required Skills:
‰Û¢ Business expertise in public cloud, private cloud and managed services at an senior level
‰Û¢ Strong technical expertise in API integration, cloud orchestration and enterprise software
‰Û¢ Proven record having worked consultative, complex deals in the enterprise
‰Û¢ Willingness to sets stretch performance standards for self and others
‰Û¢ Minimum of 12 years progressive experience in IT product management and solution engineering.
Desired skills:
‰Û¢ Demonstrated level of success in the sale of cloud services
‰Û¢ Leadership excellence in managing a portfolio of customer/partner relationships
‰Û¢ In-depth knowledge of other cloud offerings in the marketplace
‰Û¢ Strong existing industry relationships
Qualifications:

‰Û¢ Extensive experience creating and presenting highly technical presentations and concepts to small and large audiences, including C-level executives
‰Û¢ Adept and active contributions to social media (i.e. blogs and Twitter) technology forums with an existing, large influencer network
‰Û¢ Bachelor's or Master‰Ûªs degree or other technical history in computer science, electrical engineering, or other related technical fields.
‰Û¢ Superior collaboration and relationship-building skills with a strong network of senior level contacts.

Job Overview:
This Engineer II position is for a supportive role implementing Managed Security Services (MSS) in a Security Operations Center (SOC) environment. The center operates 24x7x365. The SOC function is to provide customers with constant monitoring, protection, prevention, and detection services as well as Firewall and VPN support.
Job Responsibilities:
This position will be responsible for providing the technical support to help design and implement DDoS Mitigation Services. This position will also provide additional support for Federal Government Services (MTIPS), Managed Network Based Security firewall (cloud-based), and some Managed Firewalls VPN (Premise Based).
Work typically within a single engineering discipline impacting steps within a project or process.
Ranges from limited and closely supervised contact to routine unsupervised contact with customers and contractors for the purpose of collecting and sharing information.
Frequent contact with peers and others within discipline for the purpose of collecting and sharing data. May also act as primary contact for discipline-specific information on projects. Updates manager, supervisor, and higher-level engineers on status of assignments, tasks, and projects.
Regularly provides guidance/assistance in training of less experienced technical employees within their group. Shares technical knowledge with others.
Specific direction ‰ÛÒ detailed guidance relates mostly to specific objectives, critical issues, and all concepts. Follows standard practices and procedures
Minimum Qualifications:
Requires Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in related field plus 2 years relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Good IP Routing background is a must for this job. CCNP certified engineers or CCNA certified engineers or candidates with equivalent experience (2-3 years experience in IP routing) will be preferred. Some experience and knowledge of IP Security and Firewalls would also be required.
If not previously approved, candidate may be required to submit for a T/S clearance.
DDoS Mitigation ‰ÛÒ some experience in any DDoS mitigation application is desired; Arbor background is a plus. The ability to implement complex mitigations for external customers experiencing DDoS attacks will be part of this skill set. Networking skills (i.e. ‰ÛÒ routing and switching background) would be required to be successful in this area.
Federal government ‰ÛÒ for the Networx (MTIPS) program, provide operational support on the Fortinet platform. Coordination efforts with third-party vendors and CTL groups (FedNOC, Tech Management). Networking skills (i.e. - routing background) would be required to be successful in this area. Fortinet experience is a plus. Need very good communication skills to prepare MOPS for scheduled maintenance involving multiple support groups.
Managed firewall ‰ÛÒ some experience with firewall and VPN (IPSec and SSL) technology desired. Knowledge on one or multiple platforms (Fortinet, Check Point, and Juniper) is desired. Architectural expertise desired but not limited to the areas of stateful packet inspection, address translation, denial of service, URL filtering, content inspection, content reporting, configuration and change management.
Good incident reporting skills are desired; forensics background is a plus. The ability to provide consulting, policy reviews, training, security audits and advisories, as well as support for malware/DDoS attacks, internal compromises, and other malicious events will be part of this skill set.
Good troubleshooting skills, including but not limited to TCP/IP stack protocol analysis, wireshark, application layer protocols and regex.
Hours:
We are 24/7/365, thus requires some flexibility in schedule. Current needs are:
Night shift engineer required to work Seven-on and seven-off (hours will be provided) 3rd Shift.

Job Overview:
The Lead Sales Engineer is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements, discovery, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink‰Ûªs full suite of products and solutions. The Sales Engineer is the account team subject matter expert for: Cloud, telecommunications, data networking, hosting, Virtualization, managed services and CPE solution design/engineering/consulting. Job Responsibilities:
Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal Voice, Data, CPE, Hosting or Cloud solutions.
Creatively designs solutions for customers using the best mix of CenturyLink, CTS and vendor-partner products. The Lead Sales Engineer will customize the design as needed to result in the customer choosing the CenturyLink solution.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia.
Service Delivery Manager
CenturyLink is a global IT solutions leader that powers the needs of businesses of all sizes through our hybrid IT services including public and private cloud, data centre colocation, managed hosting and network services.
In Europe, we work with leading brands, such as Cancer Research UK, easyJet, Euromoney, G4 Security and Universal Music. Every day we help our clients to deliver agility, innovation and speed to market for their businesses. Every minute they harness the scalability and economics of cloud-based technologies.
An S&P 500 company, CenturyLink is included amongst the Fortune 500 list of America's largest corporations, employing over 48000 people worldwide with operating revenue in excess of 17 billion dollars.
Job Responsibilities:
The role of the Service Delivery Manager is to manage all elements of project implementation for small and medium sized orders and to support a Principal Project Manager on larger/more complex orders. The objective of the role is to manage the successful deployment of CenturyLink solutions or products for Clients to agreed timescales, budgeted costs and the required quality levels. The Service Delivery Manager provides the main point of contact for the Client throughout the lifecycle of the project and ensures the successful handover to the CenturyLink Operations Centre on final acceptance.
Validate new orders to ensure that project deliverables are clearly defined, have departmental approval and are agreed with the Client at the initiation phase of the project.
Work with the Client Service Partner and relevant heads to ensure any deployed projects are incorporated within existing or new Client support agreements/contracts.
Provide and manage the conduit for all communication written and oral with the Client in relation to the Project.
Working in the Delivery Management team, managing, coordinating and administering projects. Responsibilities include;
Effective management of multiple small orders to ensure that the projects are delivered on time, within budget and to the Clients satisfaction.
Update CenturyLink Configuration Management Systems (i.e. Vantive) and ensure data accuracy for each project implemented.
Provide the point of contact for the Client throughout the project and/or support the Principal Project Manager on larger/more complex orders by providing workstream status reports.
Ensure the Clients expectations are set and effectively managed.
Assume overall responsibility for project delivery and activate client billing as forecasted.
Use and follow the Global-based project coordination and project management processes.
Where appropriate; document projects through the use of the high level Project Plan
Control delivery schedules and implementation quality by:
Ensuring an effective handover from Sales to the Project team.
Validate order deliverables between CenturyLink and the Client on the scope of the project.
Identifying, analysing, monitoring and mitigating project risks.
Managing change and preventing scope creep.
Record and transfer lessons from projects through the Lessons Learned Report and communicate these to the PMO.
Communicating effectively with all project stakeholders through meetings, conference calls, RAG Reports, and Hosting Integration tracker.
Liaising with Purchasing and Asset Management to ensure that equipment, software and licenses are ordered and delivered on time, to the correct location.
Monitoring the quality of technical work through reviews with relevant technical teams.
Ensuring that, where necessary, 3rd parties (such as cabling contractors) are informed of the work, and delivery method thereof, to be conducted on site.
Closing the project immediately upon completion: submitting Project Completion documents to the Client, and passing appropriate project information to CenturyLink Communications Operational and Contracts teams.
Inform management and colleagues of progress on projects by providing periodic progress reports on the performance of the project against the agreed deliverables. Escalate issues as appropriate to the Programme Manager.
Demonstrate commercial awareness by selling additional services and/or equipment.
Working with the Client to define and agree a project schedule encompassing all project activities, milestones and key dependencies.
Regularly reporting progress to the client.
Identification and effective management and communication of any required deviations from the agreed project schedule.
Principle ownership to the Client in relation to all issues that arise during the course of the project.
Work with all areas within CenturyLink to ensure the timely resolution of any identified issues to the Client‰Ûªs satisfaction.
Ensure that all necessary post-live operational support requirements are in place to facilitate Client support.
Working with the various Heads of Department to ensure that the assigned resources have the appropriate skills/ experience to undertake the project and are managed effectively.
Ensure that the assigned resources understand CenturyLink obligations under the contract and the agreed deliverables
Provide regular management of any assigned engineering resource.
Manage through to resolution any issues that are identified by the assigned engineer.
Identify and track all risks that may potentially impact upon the deliverables of the project. Analyse the technical, financial, time and Client relationship implications.
Instigate contingency plans and to mitigate any identified risks.
Ensure any agreed variation, especially relating to cost and time, is covered by a written Client instruction accepting variation.
Ensure that entrance and exit criteria for all Client acceptance tests are clearly defined in accordance with the contract.
Liaise with the relevant department heads and Client Service Partner to ensure the appropriate support arrangements are in place at final acceptance.
Minimum Qualifications:
Project coordination experience on IT projects, managing multiple concurrent small projects.
Proven Project coordination skills in a technical environment
Experienced in delivering projects to clients ensuring Client satisfaction.
Experienced in the application of Project Management methodologies preferably Prince2
Good knowledge of MS Office and MS Project.
Basic understanding of some (at least one) of CenturyLink product lines and an aptitude to take on board detailed information relating to these.
Preferred Qualifications:
External Client management experience, preferably on an international basis

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Description:
The Senior Product Manager (Product Owner) will lead in the areas of strategic product planning, software sprint planning, competitive analysis and thought leadership for our initiative to deliver a modern, managed office service to customers. The Product Manager will determine the scope of software, hardware and virtual services that comprise the offering in concert with internal stakeholders. The Senior Product Manager will have responsibility for defining customer requirements, maintaining a prioritized product backlog, helping organize Agile software sprints alongside Engineering, and acting as a product SME to the rest of the organization. The Senior Product Manager will lead cross-functional teams through ideation, business case development and formulation of product requirements, and overall lifecycle management support. The Senior Product Manager ensures the CenturyLink offerings are delivered rapidly to market, and stay current with customer needs, technology advancements, and competitive differentiation. The Senior Product Manager will work closely with development teams from product initiation to delivery and product lifecycle management.
Position Objectives:
Overall responsibility for shaping the collection of component services and the user experience that make up the managed office service
Support prioritization of requirements across product services in support of key customer personas for the products
Research competitors‰Ûª products, assesses competitive advantages and determine what product features and functionality will be built or modified
Develop strategy that will take the product through entire lifecycle from concept, design, development to market launch.
Provide strategic leadership and tactical delivery on software sprints while collaborating with Engineering, support, operations, vendors, partners, and customers.
Develop technical collateral such as knowledge base articles, product sheets, white papers, and product announcements.
Educate and inform CenturyLink team about upcoming releases and roadmap
Independently resolve issues and assist team with overcoming obstacles
Essential duties:
Demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit and interest in creating new services for customers
Intake feature requests and maintain a prioritized backlog for engineering
Organize features into user stories fit for estimation during sprint planning
Provide requirements for user stories and act as voice of the customer during software development
Build prototype solutions to incubate technologies or demonstrate potential features
Support software releases by writing knowledge base articles, blog posts, and whitepapers
Serve as single point of contact for the product offering/strategy/roadmap and interface with all Sales, Marketing, Analyst, and Customer stakeholders.
Actively seeks feedback on the product from customers (internal and external) and uses that feedback for informed product decisions
Understands and stay current with industry trends, technologies, and cloud computing models
Engage the community through social media, blog posts, and conferences
Up to 20% travel.
Required skills:
BS/BA or equivalent required, preferably marketing, computer science, MIS, etc.; MBA a plus.
8+ years of related data-driven product management of B2B or B2C software products.You must have at a minimum one full-scale product launch.
Research, data analysis and forecasting skills are a must.
Experience in, or a strong grasp of Agile philosophy, Scrum, Kanban, Lean methodologies.
Experience in one or more of telecommunications services, cloud (SaaS/PaaS), networking
Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills.
Entrepreneurial drive.
Energy, integrity, and strong work ethic.
Cross functional agility
Proactive negotiation and colloboration.
Position located in St. Louis, MO.

Job Responsibilities:
Analyzes and troubleshoots basic technical problems or issues.
Reviews and discusses service order requirements and equipment requests with customers, evaluating customers, telecommunication needs and suggesting additional/alternative service as appropriate.
Installs, maintains/repairs, and tests residential/small business telecommunication service (POTS, Hicap circuits and DSL).
Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried, underground, aerial and building work locations.
Performs splicing functions on all other types of outside plant facilities where the work requires cable sheath openings
Performs Central Office work as required to meet customer commitments
Connects wires and cables to terminals, and attaches/detaches various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings, and poles.
Uses hand tools, power tools (air and electric), and specialty tools, including electric and electronic measuring devices (e.g., multi-meters, volt-ohm meters).
Performs continuity and/or conformance testing.
Reads and interprets customer service orders, repair tickets, technical (i.e., mechanical, electrical, digital) drawings, maps, blueprints, diagrams, etc. from supervisor or other designated employees and performs specified work.
Works with telecom color-coded wires and cables.
Able to accurately locate underground cables and to repair cut cable of all sizes.
Ability to work varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, weekends and holidays.
Successful completion and passage of all applicable employment interviews.
Selected candidate is required to remain in the position for a minimum of 30 months (Time in Title) and 18 months (Time in Location)
Basic Requirements:
At least six (6) months of experience within the last five years installing, maintaining/repairing, and testing residential/small business telecommunication service, both POTS and HSI.
At least six (6) months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
Knowledge of basic electricity, as it relates to telecommunications (through classes or on-the-job training), which includes: knowledge related to the basic principles, theories, and applications of electricity (e.g., voltage, current, resistance, power, grounding, insulation, Ohm‰Ûªs Law, AC/DC); knowledge of basic electrical components (e.g., conductors, insulators, switches, capacitors, inductors, transformers) and basic circuit design; and knowledge of the operation and application of common electrical components and common measurement instruments (e.g., multi-meters, oscilloscopes).
Working knowledge of hand and power tools.
Working knowledge of test equipment (e.g., Tech Tad, Sidekick, volt-ohm meters, transmission measuring sets).
Ability to use established electrical, digital, and/or mechanical principals and to perform appropriate tests to identify and solve problems encountered on the job.
Ability to efficiently and accurately work with multiple types of information and/or perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to complete designated amount of work in a specified timeframe (e.g., quality jobs per day), adjusting work assignments or schedules to meet changing work-related priorities or demands.
Ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over-the-phone.
Ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and to foster a cooperative climate, as well as to work independently in the field with little supervision.
Ability to perceive differences in telecom wire and cable color.
Ability to climb and work at elevations (e.g., from ladders, poles, lift trucks) exceeding 18 feet.
Ability to work in confined spaces (e.g., attics, crawl spaces, utility holes).
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to: lifting objects weighing over 100 pounds.
Ability to perform job activities outdoors in different weather conditions (e.g., extreme cold and/or heat, inclement weather).
A valid State driver‰Ûªs license with a current satisfactory driving record, CDL preferred.

At least 6 months of experience within the last five years with GPON/HSI/Access Line installation and repair.
At least 12 months experience within the last five years maintaining/repairing and testing copper and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
At least 12 months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
General experience in testing and turning up DSL, and Carrier Systems.
At least six (6) months experience within the last five (5) years provisioning and maintaining DSO, DS1/T1, DS3/T3, DSL and ISDN circuits or services.
Ability to read, review, interpret and understand technical documents (e.g., schematics, drawings, blueprints, layouts).
Prior Customer Service experience.
Ability to recognize and identify sales opportunities that meet the needs of customers and the company, including promoting and closing sales of products and services.
Prior experience working on a computer in a Windows-based system and with Microsoft Outlook.
Prior experience using a body belt and safety straps.

Title: Principal Architect - Video Architecture & Engineering
Department: Video Entertainment Strategy & Development
The Principal Architect will assume the lead role within the Video Architecture, Engineering and Certification team, in developing, engineering and certifying end-to-end cloud based service delivery architecture transcending multiple Internet/Web technologies and disciplines, consisting of IP based networks from Video acquisition, processing, distribution, access and consumption infrastructure to support life-cycle management, prototyping and certification of new products and services into the network.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Architect, test and certify Video applications and cloud-based infrastructure solutions to meet diverse and complex business opportunities. Provide advanced technical leadership in testing, research, design, analysis, and problem solving efforts to the video products and services. The architecture, engineering, testing and certification scope includes micro-services based video middleware, proxy systems and clients, applications servers, core IP systems and network infrastructure.
The Principal Architect will interface with various organizational units from Video Marketing, Products to Operations, providing key architectures, engineering, inputs and solutions to testing, integration and certification requirements. The Principal Architect represents the Video Entertainment Engineering organization, from product inception to operational hand-off/market deployment of Video products and services.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prototype, Architect, Engineer, Test/integrate/validate and certify video services in an Agile and DevOps environment from Build/Development, QA, UAT, Preproduction and Production environments in a continuous integration. Produce High-Level and Low-Level Design (HLD/LLD) Documents, Test Plans, Executive Presentations of Architectures, Test Results and Designs of Cloud Service Delivery Architecture from the IP Core/Metro, Edge, and Access including IPTV/Connected Home CPE devices.
Work with vendor engineers to design and facilitate development of methods, test tools and features to support IPTV/TVE and Over-The-Top (OTT) services across managed and unmanaged networks in support of Proof of Concept testing.
Responsible for automation framework projects for virtualized and cloud computing core infrastructure including OpenStack, perform code review, continuous development/integration systems and development tools. Establish developer workflow and code review process with Atlassian software tools such as Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket. Implement continuous integration testing and release systems.
TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
DevOps with Scrum Master certified experience
Configuration Management: Ansible, Puppet, Salt
OpenStack Cloud Operating System: Compute, Networking, Storage
Intimately familiar with VMware, VirtualBox, KVM and LXC, Docker/Containers
Automate and continuous delivery of applications, container, security, compliance, infrastructure using tools such as Chef
Scalable & Redundant Network Storage Files Systems: CEPH, S3, GPFS and GlusterFS
Core IP Routing and Switching Protocols: IPv4/6, BGP, IS-IS, OSPF, HSRP, VRRP, MPLS, VPLS, GLBP including Multicast: IGMP v2, v3, PIM SM, SSM
Advanced IP networking and systems building, troubleshooting and root-cause analysis
Systems Administration of Unix and Embedded Development systems
Policing and Traffic Shaping of IP networks (QoS)
Layer 2- Layer 7 Protocols/Applications Analysis and Testing
Proficient with Servers, Routers, Switches, Load Balancers and Firewall Configuration
Systems, Network Architecture, Design, Testing, Implementation, and Operations
Proficient in coding, compiling open source tools from various FreeBSD ports, and Linux repositories
AAA Security Protocols: RADIUS, TACACS. IPSec, IEEE 802.1X Client Authentication
Multimedia Delivery protocols and containers for streaming: Live and On-Demand: Multicast, RTP, RTSP, MPEG-DASH, HLS and Smooth streaming.
Application/Content/Proxy Middleware (Client Server) understanding including storage systems and content management system (CMS)
Conformance and Benchmark testing of CPE, Access, Edge, Core, Storage and Video Systems
Thorough understanding of Standards based documents and proposals: IEEE, ITU-T, ISO, DASHIF, Internet Standards: W3C and IETF RFCs.
PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES AND KERNEL DEVELOPMENT:
C, C++, C#, Perl, TL/TCL, Expect, Phython, node.js, json, shell scripting
Intimately familiar with FreeBSD and Linux Kernel developments and programing embedded device drivers concepts and implementation
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science (Masters preferred) or equivalent education and relevant Internet Service Provide (ISP) experience. Minimum of 10+ years related experience.

Support all aspects of pre- award and potentially post-award subcontract management in the Federal Market, including teaming strategy, proposal reviews, and negotiation in a fast-paced business environment. Lead soliciting and evaluating of vendor bids or proposals through a competitive bidding process.

Job Description:
The Sr Post Sales Engineer will interface with various levels of management and multiple internal work groups and organizations to lead and direct customer service improvements, resolve customer service problems and issues, and act as the primary technical resource to the customer. Will provide a single point of contact for assigned accounts and are accessible 24x7.
Job Responsibilities:
‰Û¢ Providing customers with a superior customer service experience through communication, coordination, and facilitation.
‰Û¢ Will perform escalations to help facilitate timely and accurate resolution of repair issues. Will develop service improvement plans, process issues and solutions.
‰Û¢ Will be the post-sales technical resource for customer and account team questions, escalations, and information.
‰Û¢ Manages the overall health and welfare of complex voice and data products and services that are challenging and unique to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.
‰Û¢ Will lend expertise for responses to proposals; specifically addresses any items on RFPs pertaining to how CenturyLink performs maintenance, change management and proactive monitoring on products.
Our Post Sales Engineers are expected to have firm technical expertise in the following areas:
‰Û¢ CPE ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of M13s, fiber muxes, high end aggregation, core routers, switches, VOIP, and their applications from local access to the enterprise and WAN environments.
‰Û¢ WAN protocols ‰ÛÒ a solid understanding of network protocols.
‰Û¢ Products ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of Private Line, ATM, Frame Relay, IP, ISDN and Voice Services.
‰Û¢ Industry Terminology ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of the OSI model and principles, and a solid understanding of industry terminology i.e. POPs, COs, muxing, CPE, ILEC, HiCap.
‰Û¢ Voice/Data network design principles ‰ÛÒ A solid understanding of network design to include components end to end. A strong understanding of voice switching.
‰Û¢ Managed Services-Including data center, cloud, advanced IT services, software/applications, and consulting.
‰Û¢ LEC Provisioning and Maintenance ‰ÛÒ In-depth knowledge of basic processes and the management of LEC activities.
‰Û¢ Data Services ‰ÛÒ A firm understanding of IP routing protocols such as RIP, OSPF, NLSP, IGRP, EIGRP, BGP, EGP, IGP and how they are utilized and the impacts they present in the WAN environment. A firm understanding of IP addressing/subnetting, including private address space.
‰Û¢ Voice Services ‰ÛÒ A firm understanding of the switched and dedicated networks including VNS dial plans and basic strategies in their application within the network. A good working knowledge of inband/OOB signaling protocols, SS7 network and routing, VOIP and SIP.
‰Û¢ Network Capacity Planning ‰ÛÒ Identify and make recommendations for capacity augments where necessary.
‰Û¢ Trouble Isolation Procedures ‰ÛÒ Work with customer and CenturyLink operations technicians to identify when loopbacks are present as well as when they may be necessary to fault isolate or temporarily restore services. Able to identify and recommend test patterns used to assist in trouble resolution of DS-1 and above services. Ability to use basic router commands to assist in fault isolation and trouble resolution.

‰Û¢ Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Engineering or a related field and/or 6 years of equivalent experience in lieu of degree.
‰Û¢ 5 years industry experience supporting voice data networks of large business customers.
Preferred Qualifications:
‰Û¢ Strong analytical, decision making, problem solving, negotiation, communications (oral and written), organizational, project management, team work and presentation skills to lead and influence customer and cross- functional teams.
‰Û¢ Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables while maintaining strong customer focus.

The Area Plant Supervisor Grand Island, NE service area is committed to providing world class services that exceed customers' expectations for quality, value, and reliability. Customer satisfaction and winning customer's continued business and loyalty is what helps make our company what it is today.
As the Area Plant Supervisor you will be engaged with overseeing and directing daily operation for the service areas, and to provide quality residential and business communications services on a profitable basis while adhering to company policies, procedures and directives. The Supervisor develops and maintains an aggressive, knowledgeable, customer-focused team that promotes and sells CenturyLink products and services while providing a service experience that exceeds the customer's expectations.
The successful Supervisor enjoys working in a fast-paced, results-driven organization while managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Coordinate proper completion of service orders by their due date, handle customer complaints and repairs and service outage and major cable damage notifications.
Select competent staff in accordance with legal, Corporate and department hiring guidelines. Develop an effective staff by motivating, training, and evaluating employees.
Develop an effective staff by motivating, training and evaluating employees. Manage employee performance through coaching and guidance, assignments and workload, trianing and team dynamics.
Provide a safe work environment for employees and eliminate accidents by providing safety training and reinforcing safety requirements on the job.
Contribute to a positive Company image within the communities served by ensuring that prompt, courteous service is given to customers, and acting as the Company's representative within the community. Serve as point of contact for customer complaints.
Monitor workload and manage work schedules to ensure labor efficiency and meet service demands (i.e., overtime, weekends, evening work, etc.).
Ensure that all company equipment is inspected and routinely maintained according to established specifications to minimize equipment failures and out of service reports.
Promote harmonious and productive working relationships with utility, municipality and government-related entities by coordinating outside plant facility-related work activity with these entities.
Schedule periodic inspections and tests of equipment to prevent service interruptions.
Manage monthly departmental budget and expense guidelines.
Actively support sales and marketing efforts within assigned geographic area.
Actively promote the sale of CenturyLink products and services. Assume other duties as assigned.

Bachelor degree in business, a related field, or the equivalent in training and experience.
Minimum five (5) years of telecommunications industry experience which demonstrates a basic knowledge of telephony and outside plant construction and repair practices, and current knowledge of digital switching systems, various transmission systems and central office power systems, broadband experience and VoIP technology or the equivalent in training and experience.
Work leadership experience that demonstrates involvement in planning, directing and monitoring the work of others and ability to build group commitment to company goals and objectives.
Work experience that demonstrates strong analytical and/or problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in the use of personal computers and/or mainframe computer systems and related software including two or more of the following: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Verbal and written communications skills to interact with technical and non-technical contacts.
Basic knowledge of emerging and advanced communications technologies.
Preferred Qualifications
Supervisory experience with demonstrated ability to build group commitment to company goals and objectives.
Experience or training in how to read and interpret outside subscriber plant facility records, maps and symbols.
Specific functional experience working with on-line service order systems.
Demonstrated presentation skills that include the ability to effectively respond to customers needs through the promotion and sale of equipment and services.
Demonstrated ability to motivate, lead and coach employees in a large group in the promotion and the sale of CenturyLink products and services.
Experience and working knowledge of emerging and advanced communications technology

Design, integrate, test and deploy RF communications solutions

Must currently have a United States Government Top Secret Security Clearance with SCI.

Minimize network latency and maximize data throughput through design analysis and network performance monitoring tools.
Manage assigned tasks and provide guidance to junior Network Engineers.
Validate new and existing dataflow and data formats,
Coordinate with appropriate dataflow organizations and end-customer recipients, follow-on data repositories and tasking organizations and mitigate potential adverse impacts on system-wide dataflow.
Design, integrate, test and deploy RF communications solutions
Lead large efforts of dynamic requirements and scale
Assists System engineers and cross organizational teams to define requirements.
Resolve complex network problems; operate network analyzers, WAN test equipment and network simulators

Certifications: CCNP or Four (4) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted. An IAT level III baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required.
Must currently have a United States Government Top Secret Security Clearance with SCI.

As an Agile Coach, you will join a distributed coaching team to help mature and support our Agile transformation path.
Areas of focus:
Coaching: Working with teams to institute and practice Scrum and Scaled Agile techniques. Identify and introduce opportunities for the team to improve through coaching and questioning.
Mentoring: Serve as a mentor to Scrum Masters, Product Managers and other Agile leaders with an aim to make Agile techniques successful, resilient and permanent.
Training: Collaborate to develop Agile training materials, author newsletters, collateral materials, and support communities as they relate to Agile practices at CenturyLink. Provide scaled Agile and role-specific training (group and one-on-one) for management, team members, product managers, Scrum Masters, etc.
Observing: Observe program and team activities (e.g., sprint, release and roadmap planning) and provide constructive feedback to teams and leads.
Culture: Work with management and teams to strengthen our Agile culture. Work with teams and individuals to inspire the goals of self-determination, entrepreneurship, and customer-centered thinking.
Change Agent: Be a change agent for teams, leaders and the overall organization in establishing a lean Agile culture. Act as a galvanizing force for implementing Agile across the organization.
Servant Leadership: Practice servant leadership and promote the concept with managers within the organization.
Team Building: Foster strong and cohesive teams. Foster trust and collaboration across all team members to work as one unit. Assist teams resolving destructive conflict.
Continuous Improvement: Assist teams and leaders in executing Agile practices in a way that leads to continuous improvement.
Communication: Facilitate strong cross-organization communication on Agile techniques. Work with Scrum Masters and other Agile leaders to develop and foster cross-team communication.
Experimentation: Encourage experimentation as a tool for continuous improvement of team performance.
Coaching Collaboration: As a member of the CenturyLink‰Ûªs distributed coaching team, establish future Agile direction, develop best practices and lead incorporation of these practices and approaches across CenturyLink. Provide mentoring and support for other coaches.
Model by Behavior: Constantly strive for self-improvement in the Mastery of scaled Agile and lean techniques and practices - staying current with developing trends in the industry.
Ideal background would include:
7+ years of experience, in Agile coaching, Agile training, Release Train Engineer, Scrum Master, Product Management roles.
Experience working with software development products and Agile teams.
Demonstrated ability to guide others through the transition from a Waterfall to an Agile mindset.
Experience in Scrum and preferably SAFe (CSM, CSP, CST, SAFE Agilist desirable.)
Expertise in the areas of coaching, training, communication, leadership and motivation.
Preferred degree or global equivalent in related field.

About CenturyLink Cloud
CenturyLink Cloud (CLC) is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Corporation. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused Dev/Ops culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity. We build the cloud, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run: Every day, all the time. It‰Ûªs what we do.
At CLC, we‰Ûªve created an environment where people come together to work hard and drive results, but also offer flexibility and work-life balance. CLC is a high growth venture-backed company recognized by industry analysts as an up-and-coming cloud service provider and an innovator in cloud software.
Job Summary:
We have an opening for an experienced Senior Software Development Engineer to expand our team of engineers who are developing CenturyLink‰Ûªs cloud infrastructure.
Just like everyone else, we want to hire unbelievably bright developers, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Oh, yeah, they have to love to learn new things, too. You should have a passion for cloud computing and for creating applications and services that make developers‰Ûª lives easier while helping them create their enterprise-ready applications. Limiting yourself to just one area of the technology stack would be unthinkable for this kind of developer, so we hope that you are comfortable doing everything from creating beautiful, friendly UIs, to crafting logical and easy to use APIs, all the way to writing distributed computing algorithms between applications running on entirely different clouds.
Since our teams operate using a combination of agile development practices and processes, you‰Ûªd be encouraged to work in pairs, write your code test first, and think about things like cycle time and WIP limits. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day.
Requirements/Qualifications:
‰Û¢ 7+ years‰Ûª software development experience.
‰Û¢ 5+ years‰Ûª experience with a modern programming language like; C#, Ruby, Go or JavaScript.
‰Û¢ 3+ years‰Ûª of experience designing, building and operating highly available, highly reliable web-based systems
‰Û¢ Familiarity with programming concurrent and/or distributed systems.
‰Û¢ 2+ years of agile software development experience, TDD and refactoring.
‰Û¢ Experience developing and operating highly available, highly reliable systems.
‰Û¢ Good collaboration and communication skills.
Desired Skills:
In addition strong candidates would have some of the following:
‰Û¢ 2+ years‰Ûª developing distributed cloud architectures and infrastructure.
‰Û¢ Experience with C#, ASP.NET MVC and Web API.
‰Û¢ Experience with using or developing for Cloud Foundry in Ruby, Go.
‰Û¢ Experience with JavaScript and Node.js.
‰Û¢ Experience with SQL databases and document stores (like Couchbase and Elasticsearch) is a plus.
‰Û¢ Solid understanding of web related protocols and standards, such as HTTP, SSL, REST and JSON.
‰Û¢ Linux admin and shell scripting skills.
‰Û¢ Windows admin and PowerShell scripting skills.

Bid Manager
Purpose of Position:
Reporting into the EMEA Bid Team Manager, this role will manage professionally written proposals that clearly articulate the CenturyLink value proposition.
The Bid Manager will assemble a bid team with the relevant service / product / business knowledge required to prepare a winning bid, whilst taking ownership of the end-to-end bid process. Responsibilities include introduction and implementation of all necessary bid procedures and processes. This is a highly networked role that requires an ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines. It will require strong people management skills in a dynamic sales environment.
Supporting;
UK and German Sales Reps
USA / APAC Reps selling into the UK
Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Deliver coherent, technically correct and successful bid and proposal submissions
Balancing and prioritising multiple opportunities and manage overall delivery of information to customers in the specified timelines
Package and present information summaries on opportunities to upper management via approval boards and maintain overall status of all activities
Liaise with the other members of the Bid Team and the Bid Team Manager on proposal content to ensure it is meeting requirements of CenturyLink responses.
Draft new content as and when required
Leading and documenting Bid calls/meetings on an ongoing basis for the life cycle of the opportunity
Working with CenturyLink internal teams such as operations, engineering, pricing and legal to structure bid responses
Gaining expert knowledge of who the subject matter experts are within CenturyLink on a cross functional and company wide basis, so that the right combination of resources can be engaged to craft unique and winning bid responses
Working with key partners for areas of bids and solutions that CenturyLink cannot entirely support in-house.
Supporting delivering customer facing presentations as required.
Manage and validate the creation of key aspects of the bid, such as Technical Solution Pricing, KPIs and bid budgets.
Regularly update CenturyLink knowledge management system and use this system as one of the first point of calls for answering all bid questions.
Use CenturyLink bid and sales management tools (eg Qvidian and Salesforce.com) to manage and update bid progress.
Who will be the successful candidate?
Essential:
BSc or BA Degree in Business or Technical discipline or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in using the Microsoft Office Suite
At least 4 years' experience and proven capability in delivering winning, multi-million pound product or complex services bids.
Experience of bid campaign management from opportunity identification through to project delivery, and will provide valuable input into opportunity qualification, win strategies, commercial discussions and solution delivery.
Must be comfortable working at all levels.
Have the ability to manage complex, multi-workstream opportunities.
Solid understanding and management of internal governance procedures.
Must be an excellent communicator, both verbally and in writing
APMP Foundation level or equivalent experience
Salesforce.com
Desirable:
Consulting / Project Management background or equivalent approach
Exposure to Sales/customer environments
Commercial acumen
Experience with Qvidian Proposal Automation
APMP Practitioner or Professional level
Behavioural Competencies
We are committed to attracting skilled employees, but importantly employees who echo the standards, ethics and culture that underpin our vision and strategy. This means you will have the integrity and drive to do the "right thing", not just the "easy thing". You will be effective in working with teams of people with shared goals. You will be committed and decisive, prioritising effectively, and maintaining a clear focus to stay the course. With your energetic, positive approach you will deeply understand the importance of your colleagues and peers.

All employees or contractors that work on behalf of CenturyLink UK Ltd may be asked to undergo vetting or security clearance based on the work carried out and the requirements of our Clients. It is a condition the successful applicant is able to pass these checks.

About CenturyLink Cloud
CenturyLink Cloud (CLC) is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Corporation. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused Dev/Ops culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity. We build the cloud, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run: Every day, all the time. It‰Ûªs what we do.
At CLC, we‰Ûªve created an environment where people come together to work hard and drive results, but also offer flexibility and work-life balance. CLC is a high-growth venture-backed company recognized by industry analysts as an up-and-coming cloud service provider and an innovator in cloud software.
Summary:
CLC is looking for a smart, results-oriented Sr. Network Engineer to deploy, develop and maintain current and new network infrastructure and to automate and deploy virtualized network services for customers. This role would be part of the CenturyLink Cloud Networking product team. This role will focus on scalable, resilient and modular networking that allows customers to easily deploy their virtualized network and network services over the CenturyLink Cloud network. A can-do attitude blended together with the ability to deliver results consistently in a collaborative manner is necessary without requiring supervision or motivation.
Responsibilities:
Participate in design, implementation and automation of new network services (virtual and physical) and continue to support products after launch as an escalation point.
Configure Arista, Juniper, and Cisco hardware using best practices for performance and stability.
Research problem information to proactively identify trends and potential sources of new problems and use this information to proactively address these issues to ensure that they do not repeat.
Analyze alerts and infrastructure systems to ensure maximum performance, efficiency, and availability.
Ability to analyze infrastructure usage and plan for growth or increases in system capacity.
Identify and resolve problems affecting the infrastructure performance, efficiency, and availability in a timely manner.
Configure, install, deploy, monitor and troubleshoot network and server hardware, operating systems, and services related to networking, resolving outages and documenting designs, process and procedures.
Identify automation opportunities and assist in their implementation across our global infrastructure.

Phenomenal multi-tenant network design and troubleshooting skills.

Strong technical knowledge on Windows / Linux / Virtualization (VMware vSphere and KVM) platforms in large enterprise clustered/high availability environment.
Technical knowledge on Microsoft technologies: AD, Exchange.
Experience automating new network services (virtual and physical).
Strong understanding of enterprise/service provider infrastructure and large-scale environments.
Strong understanding of BGP, ECMP, VXLAN, ZTP, and MLAG environments.
Experience with virtual switching (Open vSwitch, NSX, etc.)
Strong scripting skills in one or more of the following is preferred: PowerShell/Python/Ruby/shell.
Self-starter with a proven record of overcoming technical and design obstacles.

Data-driven with strong history of using data to drive decisions and solutions

Job Title: Sr. Lead Product Strategy Manager

CenturyLink is the third largest telecommunications company in the United States and is recognized as a leader in the network services market by technology industry analyst firms. CenturyLink provides data, voice and managed services in local, national and select international markets through its high-quality advanced fiber-optic network and multiple data centers for businesses and consumers. Job Description:
Sr. Lead Product Strategy Manager will be responsible for assessing, developing, and assisting in setting the strategic product direction for CenturyLink. Candidate will create and execute on strategies and roadmaps in a wide range of customer segments from Global to Consumer. Candidate will identify new revenue and market opportunities by evaluating product trends and competitive offerings in the market, work closely with internal cross functional teams to define service descriptions / requirements, create uses cases, pricing, packaging, and bundling. Establish and maintain an understanding of competitive security, managed services, IT, and telecom technologies across the competitive landscape and associated market advancements.
Establish and maintain an understanding of product pricing, packaging and discounting across the competitive landscape.
Strong communication skills to ensure alignment across the business (including operations, development, product management, marketing, sales, support) and ability to communicate product plans for portfolio solutions to all stakeholders and senior management.

10 + years‰Ûª experience with strategy, product, and business case development and planning

Experience in construction of business cases, pricing, and cost models to support investment of new, innovative services
Excellent interpersonal, written and presentation skills with the ability to successfully communicate ideas and recommendations to all levels within an organization with a view to achieving objectives.
Excellent analytical, decision making, problem solving, and organizational skills
Experience in contract negotiations and vendor management
Bachelor's degree, B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent field with MS or MBA preferred

Job Overview:
The CenturyLink AS EMEA Senior Client Service Partner is accountable for delivery to CenturyLink clients working across the service lifecycle, service delivery and program and project management ensuring revenue retention and growth as well as customer satisfaction. This role has direct responsibility for assuring both client and sales intimacy across all business vertical. Additional responsibilities include maintaining established delivery and quality metrics, developing strong relationships with a broad array of business executives and assisting the sales organization in maintaining those through delighting in their delivery experience. The Delivery leader will develop a successful team of direct reports and cross organisational processes in support of improving client relationships. Industry and leadership experience are core competencies needed to provide business, financial and contractual guidance to managers and other direct reports. This position will include an element of P&L accountability.

Single point of ownership for the Client.
Work at different levels within CenturyLink and the client organization
Maintain direct involvement with client executives and mentor direct reports
Contribute and implement new ideas that lead to a more cost effective delivery and program management, including advising on global change process
Schedule and lead effective team meetings which will include field and or corporate resources aligning to global standards and processes as required
Establish and maintain an active local or regional network of qualified, successful candidates for individual contributor support positions
Continuously improve the customer experience by taking ownership and holding teams accountable via customer link
Single senior point of contact and accountable for actions resulting from the Sales organisation requirements and escalations for all delivery related matters.
Take a kaizen approach to all aspects of the account
Liaise with clients on all PPM and delivery escalations as required
Carry out governance checks to ensure the portfolio of projects remains within time, cost and quality tolerances.
Work with the PMO to produce timely and accurate management reports.
Engage with Engineering Team Leads and other Department Heads to prioritise projects and available resources.
Co-ordinate across the Service Delivery and Program Management functions to align the sales pipeline with available PPM and Engineering capacity and assign PM‰Ûªs to new orders.

Managing operations and maintenance of all data center infrastructure equipment (critical and non-critical)

Schedule and supervise the performance of both routine maintenance and emergency service on critical systems, including: diesel generators, UPS systems, electrical switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, HVAC equipment, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
