Manage local facilities team
Manage all facilities documentation (planning, development, and implementation)
Coordination with all other groups (sales, NOC, network, finance, executive staff)
Negotiation and approval of vendor contracts/agreements
On-call 24x7 for incident management and data center emergency response.
Responsible for site safety and environmental compliance.
Required Skills:
Strong management and leadership skills.
Extensive knowledge of data center critical systems, including: diesel generators, UPS systems, fuel systems, switchgear, power distribution equipment, chillers, computer room air handlers, fire detection/suppression and building monitoring systems.
Must have the ability to make solid business decisions in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Candidate must display confidence in client-facing situations.
Team player with excellent consultative and communication skills and the proven ability to work effectively with internal and external clients, vendors and consultants.
Education or Equivalent Experience:
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
5-10 years of facilities experience in mission critical environments with 3 years in a supervisory/management role.
CFM or equivalent facilities management certification desired.
Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Mechanical or Electrical) or equivalent.

Job Overview:
This position requires a high degree of technical competencies providing input on many layer 1 network technologies to many and various CenturyLink network and product organizations. The position assumes ownership and accountability in areas of recognized technical expertise and provides technical leadership, guidance and assistance across different segments. Primary focus on accountability for Transport (SONET, DWDM, OWS) network platforms to bring alignment and governance to new hardware, software and products being deployed to ensure all requirements are identified and met through various stages to reach operational readiness. Process Improvements focuses include identify, prioritize and maintain scalability and performance gaps and manage remediation activities. Perform audits within the network as part of ongoing evaluation of scalability parameters as new products are introduced. Remediate gaps in existing deployments which aren‰Ûªt limited to alarming, capacity, scalability parameters. The key is to focus on being proactive with network assessments with scalability and reliability as the driving factor. The position is a 8a-5p Monday thru Friday without on-call. Requires technical communication skills since documentation writing and presenting finding to technical and management teams are part of the routine function.
Job Responsibilities:
Creation, data collection, configuration databasing and vendor technology management coordination to establish and modify operational scalability limits of all Layer 1 and 2 Transport elements.
Implement and validate parameters.
Identify, track, and remediate gaps for all Layer 1 and 2 Transport network.
Implementation of appropriate thresholds into the necessary system monitoring tools.
Process for threshold breach response and remediation.
Ongoing review of scalability changes and responsible for communications to appropriate parties.
Review of element change management procedures as appropriate.
FOA requirements and acceptance.
Applies approved technologies and architectures to specific requirements for network additions to support growth, new services and network optimization.
Partners with Corporate Strategy and Technology Management on products and new technology deployment.
Consistently requires complex thinking and solutions deployment.

Position Overview:
The CenturyLink Platform Development Center, based in Bellevue, Washington, is the epicenter of service automation for CenturyLink. Our mission is to provide world-class information technology services to global businesses on virtual, dedicated and physical infrastructure using a common provisioning user experience. We call this Platform CenturyLink.
The Platform Enablement team sits within the Platform Development Center, and is focused on the business strategies that help achieve a true ‰ÛÏplatform‰Ûù effect around CenturyLink. This means engaging with the technology, software, service and startup communities to motivate investment that drives effectiveness of the customer ecosystem. The Platform Enablement team is broadly responsible for user success, evangelizing our platform to the market, and recruiting new partners to our environment, as well as supporting those stakeholders with the metrics necessary to drive insight.
Within the Cloud Platform team, the Senior Software Development Engineer will be responsible for the digital web platform that surrounds Platform CenturyLink ‰ÛÒ the automated, interactive, adaptable ‰ÛÏinstruction manual‰Ûù for the platform which engages, inspires, and informs our base of users, developers and partners. This resource will be responsible for growing the number of users that work with our platform, increasing the engagement of the CenturyLink Business clientele.
About Platform CenturyLink:
Just like everyone else, we want to hire unbelievably bright people, who are a joy to work with, love to work with others, solve problems, listen well, and lead as appropriate. Let‰Ûªs not forget that they also have to love to learn new technology. Our team members should have a passion for ensuring our services and solutions are effective and that we are solving problems for our customers. A team member limiting themselves to a narrowly-focused job description would be unthinkable for this kind of user-facing role. We hope that you are comfortable doing everything from listening to customers, identifying risk, assisting with documentation, representing the platform, and driving user satisfaction.
Platform CenturyLink is the focal point for all cloud-related development inside the larger CenturyLink Business organization. We consciously maintain our small company/startup feel, while taking advantage of the resources available from such a large company. As such, we have a very strongly focused DevOps culture, highly skilled agile workforce, with development as our core activity.
Since our teams operate using a combination of agile development practices and processes, you‰Ûªd be encouraged to work in pairs, write your code test first, and think about things like cycle time and WIP limits. All of this adds up to an exciting, challenging, and always interesting place to work, where hard problems are found and solved every day.
We are building our cloud platform, we build the applications that run on it, and we make it run. Every day, all the time. It‰Ûªs what we do. CenturyLink offers competitive salaries and benefits.

Lead Information Security Engineer
Job Description
Perform as the ISSO (Information Systems Security Officer) for Federal systems.
Lead security authorization processes and procedures.
Write System Security Plans, POA&Ms (Plan Of Actions and Milestones), Risk Assessments, PIAs (Privacy Impact Analyses), and supporting documentation for systems subject to NIST SP 800-53.
Achieve and maintain ATO (Authority To Operate), as required.
Develop, implement, and evaluate security CONOPS (Concept of Operations), System Security Plans and/or System Security Authorization Agreements to satisfy Certification and Accreditation requirements in accordance with NIST 800-53, FISMA, Risk Management Framework (RMF) and other government guidelines, as required.
Writes BC (Business Continuity)/DR (Disaster Recovery)/CP (Contingency Plans)/COOP (Continuity of Operations) plans, test plans, and test reports for federal systems.
Manages Information Security Audits by federal departments/agencies, including third party auditors.
Assesses emerging network system and enterprise-level risks and vulnerabilities. Advises leadership on cyber security risk management, security strategy, security project planning, and security architecture.
Negotiates InfoSec-related contracts and contract language with business partners and customers. Responds to RFPs (Requests For Proposals) and RFIs (Request For Information)from government entities.
Experience with HBSS, ACAS or similar security tools. Perform scans, review the results, write necessary reports and remediation plans.
Conduct periodic reviews to ensure compliance with established policies and procedures ensuring all software, hardware and firmware changes recorded as required by established configuration management procedures
Ensure systems are operated, maintained and disposed of in accordance with applicable governing policies and procedures
Perform IS security briefings, report all security incidents to the ISSM (Information Systems Security Manager), and investigate, document and report, as well as provide protective and corrective measures in response to such incidents
Coordinate and participate in special projects concerning information security, including testing and implementation of security software enhancements
Develop, facilitate, and present information security awareness and security training on various customer and corporate security policies
Maintain a broad knowledge of technology, equipment and/or systems to include the configuration, maintenance, analysis and use of computer forensics tools, steganography and metadata tools, audit reduction tools, firewalls, various operating systems, and phone switches
Interface with appropriate government agencies, company management and employees, customers, vendors, and suppliers to ensure understanding of and compliance with security requirements
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum of six (6) years of experience with Certification & Accreditation (C&A) or Assessment & Authorization (A&A).
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Strong oral and written communication skills
Associate or Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in MIS
CISSP/MCSE/MCSA/CCNA/A+/Network+ Certifications
eMass / RMF training and experience
Some required travel. Less than 15%
Must be able to obtain TS/SCI

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. The Regional Engineer (Mechanical) is accountable for driving operational excellence across CenturyLink Technology Solutions Data Centers through engineering, planning, maintenance, and documentation of Data Center operations and associated mission critical infrastructures. CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Location: Poulsbo, WA
Requisition: 59713
Overview: To install telephone plant facilities and high-speed internet at customer premises according to specifications directed and established by CenturyLink procedures. To maintain, expand, replace and repair all plant facilities and subscriber apparatus required to provide service to customers. Interact directly with CenturyLink customers and support sales efforts through YouCan.
Job Responsibilities:
1) Install, repair, test, and modify line and station telephone equipment for customers using hand tools, power tools, and computer interfaces. Includes repairs to outside wires and tree trimming, and placing new drops.
2) Inspect subscriber premises to determine the appropriate method of installation.
3) Test newly installed telephone/equipment using testing devices and repairs or replaces faulty equipment. Perform appropriate testing to ensure proper transmission and supervision specifications.
4) Work closely with the Dispatch Center for work assignments such as trouble reports and service orders. Record transmission readings, daily time, and function codes in Work Force Management.
5) Install and maintain subscriber PairGain Devices.
6) Refurbish cable and install facilities within pedestals and/or terminals.
7) Actively support sales and marketing related activities through the Take the Lead Program.
8) Climb poles using either hooks, ladders or bucket trucks, attach terminal boxes and carrier housings, and repair or replace defective lines and auxiliary equipment.
9) Unreel and string aerial lines; install conduits and pole hardware.
10) Pull lines through conduit by hand or with use of a winch.
11) Observe all safety rules and regulations.
12) Correct prints and maintain as-builts in accordance with company practices and policies.
13) Install and maintain video, data, and station wiring and apparatus, maintain loop plant, including analog and digital subscriber carrier.
14) Assist other Technical personnel in the performance of their duties when requested.
15) Transporting, set up, and running of portable generator sets.
16) Locate buried telephone cables.
17) Installation/troubleshooting of high-speed internet and data networks.
18) Must convey a positive and professional appearance and demeanor when communicating the company‰Ûªs products and services to our customers.
19) Assume all other duties as assigned.
Basic Requirements:
1) Education: High School Diploma or GED.
2) Experience: One year of current telecommunications industry experience in one or more of the following areas: installation, maintenance, and repair of aerial, buried and underground wire and cable; telephones; switched digital television; High Speed Internet; building wiring; station equipment; or equivalent in education and training.
3) Incumbent must be technically proficient in order to perform the specific work requirements of the job in the particular location.
4) Must have working knowledge of PC‰Ûªs, including basic computer operational tasks.
5) Must have strong interpersonal communication skills for communicating CenturyLink‰Ûªs products and services to customers.
6) Must possess a valid driver‰Ûªs license, be able to safely operate company vehicles and equipment, and maintain a safe driving record.
7) Must be able to safely use hooks, ladders, bucket trucks; and to climb poles.
8) Must have capability to distinguish colors on facilities.
9) Heavy lifting as required.
10) May work in confined spaces.
11) Ability to work outside in all weather conditions and at various hours of the day/night.
12) Must be able to respond to after hour call-outs, work overtime, shift, weekends, and holidays as required.
13) Must be able to travel overnight as necessary for business requirements and training.
14) Ability to maintain an excellent attendance record.
Preferred Qualifications:
1) Associate‰Ûªs Degree in Electronics/Communications.
2) CCNT, CCNA, Network+, or A+ Certifications.
3) Training on basic IT and network fundamentals.
4) Experience in Outside Plant functions.
5) Subscriber carrier training.
6) Pole climbing training.
7) Experience or training in how to read and interpret outside and subscriber plant facility records.
8) Internet protocol telephony exposure.
9) Electronics training or experience that demonstrates knowledge of AC/DC theory.
10) Experience splicing fiber optics.
11) Knowledge of analog and digital transmission.
12) Experience with installation and troubleshooting of high-speed internet services.
13) Proven ability to generate sales opportunities during day-to-day customer contact

Senior Financial Analyst
Date: May 26th 2016
Job Req: 56710
Location(s): Winnersh, Berkshire
CenturyLink is a global IT solutions leader that powers the needs of businesses of all sizes through our hybrid IT services including public and private cloud, data centre colocation, managed hosting and network services.
In Europe, we work with leading brands, such as Cancer Research UK, easyJet, Euromoney, G4 Security and Universal Music. Every day we help our clients to deliver agility, innovation and speed to market for their businesses. Every minute they harness the scalability and economics of cloud-based technologies.
An S&P 500 company, CenturyLink is included amongst the Fortune 500 list of America's largest corporations, employing over 48000 people worldwide with operating revenue in excess of 17 billion dollars.
Job Responsibilities:
The role of Snr Analyst is to be to be the finance business partner for the entire EMEA group and the Snr Analyst will have supervisory responsibility for junior analyst(s) within the team aligned to the sales and operational organisations. Key objectives of the team are assisting in the production of management reports, forecasts, annual budgets and ad hoc analysis. The Snr Analyst will lead in the direction of the above as well as present information to all level around the EMEA forecast and plans.
The Snr Analyst is responsible for leading the Finance Planning and Analysis team in a number of key projects and reporting. The successful candidate will have responsibility for producing weekly/monthly reports for the organization as well KPI measures. The Snr Analyst will also have an opportunity to work on various projects as well as engage at all levels in the organization alongside having responsibility for reporting on his or her business unit.
Hold key position as part of EMEA leadership, be key finance business partner for Directors and Managers in that team developing close and effective relationships with each member, MD and VP‰Ûªs
Manage EMEA annual budget process. Production of budgets with key stakeholders and assisting management to achieve these and understand these budgets through regular reviews and consultation.
Responsibility in the collation, analysis and publication of the Monthly Business Review pack to the executive team. Work on development of the business scorecard to cover key leading indicators around performance for sales, service, operations, delivery and support.
Manage, coach and develop a team of qualified and part qualified analysts in work and study.
Stand in and support to head of finance and/or MD EMEA in monthly corporate or senior exec reviews.
Key decision support resource to head of finance for all ongoing activities and operation affecting the EMEA business. Multi-skilled in all areas around the business and take ownership of new initiatives, product and process.
Manage monthly results and performance review with Global Cost Centre Managers providing feedback and recommendations where required.
Production and review of product P&L‰Ûªs, working with commercial teams to understand product & customer margins and key drivers feeding back into commercial and strategic decision making process.
Produce granular KPI reporting package to provide important and strategic business information to senior exec team, identify predictive of outcome KPI‰Ûªs.
Coordinate with budget managers and purchasing group‰Ûªs to analyse where and when expenditure will be required and whether Capex investment is recommended.
Management & review of the renewals and assistance in the churn account management working with commercial teams providing relevant business information for these areas.
Support VP Sales in management of reps and Solutions Engineers towards booking target through production of accurate and useful reporting and consultation of sales strategy and areas of risk.
Management and development of sales commissions plan.
Produce and validate Expansion business cases with budget holders supporting head of finance.
Report and analyse on efficiency and capacity within IDC‰Ûªs relating to space and power, e.g. stranded KW, KW yield per product.
Develop customer level resource utilisation reporting and full costing models for customer specific support, change and installations
Various profitability audits / revenue assurance projects on server estate, software etc. Assist in the facilitation inventory management with key stakeholders in Procurement, the operations business and Finance.
Ad-hoc financial project and analysis touching all parts and aspects of the entire business.
Minimum Qualifications:
CIMA or equivalent qualified / finalist
Contributes in the compilation of Monthly Performance Pack by performing variance analysis and providing insightful commentary on significant deviations from plan
Develop and maintain a reporting suite with and for key stakeholders and make recommendations which drive operational efficiencies
Develop close and effective working relations with all key internal customers
Become key advisor on all Sales & Operations decisions
Preferred Qualifications:
Management Accounting or Financial background within a analytical role in a commercial environment
Ability to work independently and communicate with senior management effectively and confidently
Strong eye for accuracy and completeness in work undertaken
Strong PC literacy including, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, as well as SAP or similar accounting package or MS Access

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
The CenturyLink Implementation Assurance Technician (IAT) is responsible for augmentation and validation of blueprints for Managed Hosting solutions of varying complexity and scope. The IAT collaborates with the Solution Delivery Coordinator, Solution Engineer, and Technical Implementation resources, to ensure timely validation of the commercial and technical details which comprise solutions for CenturyLink customers.
IAT conducts an initial review of the Connectivity Work Plan (CWP) and Technical Design Configurator (TDC) to determine whether or not the Minimum Data Set has been provided by the Solution Engineer (SE.) If yes, IAT hands off an agenda and stakeholder list to the Solution Delivery Coordinator, for a solution review/kickoff call. If no, the IAT contacts the Solution Engineer detailing the Minimum Data Set items which are missing, and assists the SE in obtaining missing information wherever possible. Once the Minimum Data Set has been provided, the kickoff call will be scheduled.
On the kickoff call, the SDC positions themselves as the owner of the project and single point of contact for customers. The IAT is positioned as playing a supportive role up through ‰Û÷Tech Doc Confirmation,‰Ûª assisting with integration activities and identifying potential problems.
Once the customer and Solution Engineer confirm the solution overview and specific requirements on the kickoff call, IAT leverages extensive CenturyLink Managed Hosting product knowledge, Implementation experience, strong technical background, an analytical mindset, and various tools (Looking Glass, Network Query Tool, Port Allocation Tool, VLAN Allocation Tool, etc.) and job aids to fully complete TDC. The end result is ‰Û÷build-ready‰Ûª blueprints fit for client approval.
IAT remains available to accept escalations from SDC or TI, should a Tech Doc Related build incident arise.
IAT will also evaluate SE inputs and conduct problem management.
Position Objectives
Increase client satisfaction by reducing the Client Experience interval (measured from CWP created date, to the date the Tech Docs are completed and approved by the customer.)
Champion the use of TDC, and contribute to its enhancement by working with Product Analysts to maintain proper product definitions within TDC.
Achieve revenue acceleration by decreasing installation intervals through quality inputs into TDC and the Technical Implementation build queues.
Reduce Implementation re-work, build incidents, and burn-in cases through quality inputs into TDC and the Technical Implementation build queues.
Develop and maintain Execution Checklists to aid the SDC in properly detailing Connectivity Actions.
Essential Duties
Responsible for adhering to the Implementation Assurance process.
Responsible for evaluating new orders for commercial accuracy, and obtaining the Minimum Data Set from the Solution Engineer.
Responsible for fostering effective kickoff calls.
Responsible for completing the Full Data Set, providing all required build detail within the TDC.
Allocating IPs (new subnets, and identifying available interface IPs out of existing VLANs)
Allocating VLANs
Allocating HAN Ports
Mapping the physical cabling layout of new physical devices
Planning the use of allocated IPs (IP Breakdowns)
Detailing the required tasks which comprise the solution, the order in which they must occur, and all pertinent detail required for Technical Build tasks associated with the project.
Responsible for tracking Implementation Assurance CAs, and communicating progress through the use of CWP and CA notes.
Responsible for guiding SEs and SDCs on product capabilities, standards, functionality, requirements.
Responsible for Problem Management of SE inputs.
Responsible for reducing tech-doc related build incidents, and accepting escalations to quickly resolve any which may arise.
Responsible for maintaining collaborative relationships with key Product, Sales Engineering, GSIO, and operational organizations.
Required Skills
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Information Technology and Services.
Minimum of 3 years of experience implementing CenturyLink products and services.
Comprehensive and working knowledge of CenturyLink product portfolio, specifically Managed Hosting products.
Understanding key components of IT implementation architecture and best practices.
Ability to understand a Visio diagram.
Analytical/problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, written, presentation and communication skills.
Ability to develop effective key collaborative relationships across organizational boundaries.
Strong customer relationship management skills.
Desired skills
Prior experience in CenturyLink Operations Center or Product organizations (in addition to required Implementation experience.)
Technology Background related to design and configuration.
Proficiency in enterprise systems: TDC, Vantive, Cordys, Big Machines, Activiti
Education or Equivalent Experience
Bachelor‰Ûªs Degree in related field or equivalent work experience.
6+ years experience in an IT environment

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. Information Security Governance ‰ÛÒ International Business Risk ‰ÛÒ Senior Lead Information Security Engineer
Position Summary: The Senior Lead Information Security Engineer is a member of the Information Security Governance/IBRR team that is responsible for Global Data Protection and conducting International Business Risk Reviews (IBRR) to address security risks with new work moving to international locations, and working with IT to assess applications and verify Clean Room controls. The Engineer contributes to CenturyLink‰Ûªs Global Data Protection program in a leadership role by establishing/improving processes to conduct risk assessments on proposed international activities; eliciting business requirements from multiple business stakeholders; converting business requirements to technical requirements and coordinating their implementation with IT Services, Network Services and other project teams; and facilitating meetings with the International Business Risk Review Council (IBRRC), if necessary.
The successful candidate will have broad technical knowledge of current and emerging cyber threats, as well as security technologies and methods used to protect both corporate and customer-facing network infrastructures. This candidate must be able to work independently and as a team leader to develop and execute strategies and consult with internal clients on advanced security topics. In addition, the candidate must possess excellent oral and written communications skills and experience in presenting technical issues to a wide variety of audiences.
Responsibilities:
Define the security direction for the organization, including systems, networks, user services, and vendor development efforts.
Consult with senior management and internal clients across multiple business units on complex security topics and policy interpretation.
Proactively identify potential security issues within the corporate and carrier infrastructure, and provide strategic direction to avoid risks to CenturyLink information assets.
Ensure reports and findings are delivered in a timely and appropriate manner to management, operations and executive leadership.
Develop relationships and engage with industry partners, Security Information Exchanges, and other groups to assess industry advances in technical security technologies. Assess security industry trends and provide consultation, recommendations, and implementation advice on emerging technologies.
Test potential security solutions to validate features and functions, partnering with other organizations in the resolution of interoperability issues to obtain successful integration of security solutions across all platforms.
Understand new laws and regulations and provide consultation, recommendations, and implementation advice to the organization. Make necessary adjustments to the Information Security Policy.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor‰Ûªs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or 12+ years of equivalent experience.
Extensive experience in the administration, design and implementation of security controls including experience in applying methodologies and principles for all levels of security.
Exceptionally strong oral and written communication skills, collaboration skills, and experience in presenting technical issues to all levels of management, as well as non-technical staff.
Must possess current applicable professional/technical certifications, such as CISSP, GPEN, GWAPT, GISEC, CISM or CISA.
Experience with technologies, tools and process controls to minimize risk and data exposure.
Strong understanding of common computing attack vectors; information, host and network security hardening and requirements; networking protocols; common intrusion techniques; and common risk management concepts.
Broad technical knowledge of current and emerging technologies used both within the corporate infrastructure and in delivering customer facing services.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master‰Ûªs Degree and 8+ years of relevant work experience.
Knowledge of information security industry and regulatory obligations (ISO 27001/27002, SOX, PCI, NIST Framework, FISMA, HIPAA, NACHA, and SSAE-16).
Technical credentials including vendor and / or technically agnostic certifications.
Experience in project management practices and/or PMP certification.
Experience in large Enterprise data centers and/or networks.

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Job Description:
The fully qualified Technical Field Service Specialist (TFSS) is a recognized leader in the communications industry. Generally, a TFSS is looked upon as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) to peers, customers, and internal departments. The Specialist provides technical consulting, installation and maintenance of highly complex and sophisticated products, services, and technologies offered by CenturyLink.
This is a fast paced job where multitasking is required with an ability to prioritize tasks.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide technical consulting on installation, maintenance, testing and modification of complex integrated systems, including prototype equipment and experimental services.
Resolve complex network problems involving power, network hardware and/or software
Install and maintains private and switched services, including sub-rate and high speed data, audio/video services and associated ancillary equipment configured to meet existing and anticipated customer needs.
Install, provision, test and/or maintain Digital Circuit Networks including Metro Ethernet, Frame Relay, LAN/WAN and LAN interconnect.
Install, test and maintains Cisco Call Manager, Polycom VOIP and video systems
Repair cable and perform continuity testing.
Solve new turn-up issues by conducting various diagnostic tests using conventional and specialized test equipment and referring to vendor/manufacturer provided documentation to identify the extent and source of obscure, hard-to-resolve problems that have defied routine troubleshooting techniques.
Solve chronic repair problems by conducting various diagnostic tests using conventional and specialized test equipment and by referring to vendor/manufacturer provided documentation to identify the extent and source of obscure, hard-to-resolve problems that have defied routine troubleshooting techniques.
Perform project management and coordination role on the end-to-end installation of complex integrated systems to assure that contractual requirements and responsibilities are met by the following: being involved in the planning and layout of the job; providing input to the development of charts showing the sequence of activities and critical timelines; directing the work of others towards meeting completion responsibilities; interfacing with vendors, subcontractors, other technicians and customers to schedule/complete planned activities. (In general, work requiring the project coordination function will involve several of the elements stated above.)
Maintain and test complex systems such as fiber optics, digital and/or multiplexers.
Maintain and test carrier systems, fiber optic cable, digital and/or multiplexers and special service circuits.
Interpret and work with schematics, circuit drawings, circuit diagrams, Visio drawings, engineering.
Utilize various testing devices such as frequency and data signal generators, transmission measuring sets, oscilloscopes, volt-ohm meters, while installing and maintaining equipment and services
Maintain level of personal technical expertise by being knowledgeable of available resources, diagnostic equipment, company practices, operating manuals, vendor-provided literature and other experts to maintain/increase capability to solve technical problems.
Provides information needed to close out work orders/trouble reports by indicating type of work performed, time and material charges, exception codes, field reporting codes and other work related information.
Provide on-the-job or classroom training on new products and technologies, their features, usages and applications
Interface with other work groups to ensure that committed service and test dates are met and to test the integrity of service prior to customer release.
Respond to inquiries or complaints from customers, solve problems and provide technical advice or assistance in utilizing appropriate products or services. Act as customer advocate.
Collaborate with other support teams in Customer IT Departments.
Other duties as assigned by management.
Work Environment:
Communicates with others to provide technical guidance on systems and components.
Is exposed to variable environmental and work conditions.
Wears safety glasses, hard hat, appropriate safe clothing and follows established safety practices and procedures.
Wears attire that is appropriate for effective interaction with customers.
Successful candidate must fulfill Time-in-Title requirement of 30 months, and Time-in-Location requirement of 18 months.
Basic Job Qualifications:
Strong technical skills working on complex installation and provisioning activities.
Solid knowledge of network OSI layers 1, 2, and/or 3.
Troubleshooting, provisioning, and/or turn-up experience with Ethernet, ATM, Frame Relay service and/or other data products.
Troubleshooting, provisioning, and/or turn-up experience with Cisco, Ciena, ALU, Adtran, RAD, Juniper and/or other vendor hardware.
Experience with, understanding of and/or knowledge of protocols and protocol analyzers.
Cisco platforms, networking, routing and protocols.
Experience with Cisco Call Manager & Call Manager Express.
Experience with Cisco Unity Voice mail Cisco Emergency Responder.
Experience with Cisco IPCC Express.
Experience with Cisco Personal Assistant.
Experience with Nortel systems.
Experience with Voice over IP applications.
Experience installing business systems.
Ability to use established electrical, digital, and/or mechanical principals and to perform appropriate tests to identify and solve problems encountered on the job. Ability to use software and hardware tools to identify and diagnose network status and issues.
Working knowledge of hand and power tools.
Ability to input and/or retrieve information from PCs or CRT terminals, to include company data bases.
Ability to utilize PC software such as word processing, graphics, spreadsheets and data base management tools.
Ability to efficiently and accurately work with multiple types of information and/or perform multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and to foster a cooperative climate,
Ability to direct the work of others, commit company resources within defined levels, and escalate problems.
Ability to work independently in the field with little supervision.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Possession of customer service soft skills with ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over the phone.
Willingness to promote CenturyLink and CenturyLink products
Ability to recognize and identify sales opportunities that meet the needs of customers and the company including promoting and closing sales of products and services.
Ability to work day, evening, or night shifts; also to work overtime, emergency call-outs, weekends and holidays as required.
On short notice, travel to remote or distant locations within assigned territory.
Be away from home overnight(s) on temporary assignments for varying length of time.
Works independently with minimal or no supervision
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to, lifting and/or moving up to 100 pounds.
Ability to perceive differences in wire and cable color.
Satisfactory performance and attendance in present job.
Possession of a valid state driver's license, satisfactory driving record, and the ability to drive vehicle with manual gear shift.
Ability to meet standards of security investigation, if required
Preferred Job Qualifications:
1+ year troubleshooting, provisioning and/or turn-up experience with Ethernet, IP, VOIP, DSL, DS0, DS1, DS3, ATM, and/or Frame Relay.
Advanced knowledge of OSI network layers 1, 2, 3 and above.

As a Centurylink Network Technician Installation and Maintenance in the Grand Island, NE service area, you will be responsible for all aspects of cable repair and maintenance. This includes but is not limited to repairs on POTS and DSL services, buried section repairs, rehab and corrective action on irregular plant conditions in all aerial, buried and underground plant.
Job Responsibilities:
Makes splicing rearrangements on existing facilities in buried ,underground, aerial and work locations.
Uses heavy-duty power equipment (e.g., compressors, pumps, blowers), hand tools, power tools (air and electric), and specialty tools, including electric and electronic measuring devices (e.g., multi-meters, volt-ohm meters), in the construction and repair of outside plant facilities.
Performs testing and turn-up of subscriber lines, carrier plant, and/or fiber optic plant.
Locates and repairs air leaks in aerial, underground, and/or buried cable.
Locates, joins, repairs and rearranges cable and cable conductors in buildings and aerial or buried plant.
Installs, maintains/repairs, and tests residential/small business telecommunication service (POTS and DSL) HSI.
Connects wires and cables to terminals, and attaches/detaches various kinds of hardware to wires, cables and buildings.
Performs continuity and/or conformance testing.
Reads and interprets customer service orders, technical (i.e., mechanical, electrical, digital) drawings, maps, blueprints, diagrams, etc.
Receives service orders, worksheets (detailed diagrams describing nature and location of equipment to be installed or repaired) and repair tickets from supervisor or other designated employees and performs specified work.
Works with telecom color-coded wires and cables
Basic Qualifications
INTERNAL Candidates:
Internal Candidates must meet Time in Title/Location requirements of their current position for consideration.
Knowledge of basic electricity, as it relates to telecommunications (through classes or on-the-job training), which includes: knowledge related to the basic principles, theories, and applications of electricity (e.g., voltage, current, resistance, power, grounding, insulation, Ohm‰Ûªs Law, AC/DC); knowledge of basic electrical components (e.g., conductors, insulators, switches, capacitors, inductors, transformers) and basic circuit design; and knowledge of the operation and application of common electrical components and common measurement instruments (e.g., multi-meters, etc.).
Working knowledge of test equipment (e.g., Tech Tad, Sidekick, 965DSP, transmission measuring sets).
Ability to use established electrical, digital, and/or mechanical principals and to perform appropriate tests to identify and solve problems encountered on the job.
Ability to efficiently and accurately work with multiple types of information and/or perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to complete designated amount of work in a specified timeframe (e.g., quality jobs per day), adjusting work assignments or schedules to meet changing work-related priorities or demands.
Ability to provide efficient, quality service to both internal and external customers both face-to-face and over-the-phone.
Ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and to foster a cooperative climate, as well as to work independently in the field with little supervision.
Ability to climb and work at elevations up to 18 feet.
Ability to work in confined spaces (e.g., attics, crawl spaces, utility holes).
Ability to perform strenuous physical activities including, but not limited to: lifting objects weighing up to 75 pounds.
Ability to perform job activities outdoors in different weather conditions (e.g., extreme cold and/or heat, inclement weather).
A valid State driver‰Ûªs license with a current satisfactory driving record.
Ability to work varying shifts and hours including possible mandatory overtime, weekends and holidays.
Preferred Job Qualifications:
At least 6 months experience within the last five years maintaining/repairing and testing copper and/or fiber optic cable in an underground, aerial, or buried environment.
At least 6 months of experience within the last five years connecting telecom color-coded wires and cables to terminals, attaching or detaching various kinds of hardware to wires, cables, buildings and poles.
General experience in testing and turning up DSL, and Carrier Systems.
Ability to read, review, interpret and understand technical documents (e.g., schematics, drawings, blueprints, layouts).
Prior Customer Service experience.
Ability to recognize and identify sales opportunities that meet the needs of customers and the company, including promoting and closing sales of products and services.
Prior experience working on a computer in a Windows-based system and with Microsoft Outlook.
Prior experience using a body belt and safety straps

Job Description
The Hosting compute department is accountable for all platform support for CenturyLink managed hosting Clients, Comprising of Incident Management, Change Management, Request Fulfillment and interacting closely with Problem management.
The Senior IT Engineer (Senior Unix Engineer) is member of JP Hosting Operations and working with peer positions in the US, EMEA and APAC regions. The successful candidate will be capable of meeting demands for timely customer facing feedback on on-going escalated issues, root cause reports and will drive internal technical teams towards the effective and efficient operations activities as assigned by regional or global mgmt. They will provide superior support to a subset of CenturyLink Clients in a complex network and/or hosting solutions environment. The engineer will review, approve and execute change requests to ensure successful change management. They will troubleshoot systems and network incidents to provide the maximum availability and optimal Mean Time To Repair.
Position Objectives:
Deliver superior customer service through professional, comprehensive, and timely communication for all Incidents and Requests for Change
Ensure timely response, escalation, and resolution to promote the rapid restoration of services for all incidents
Through review and approval, ensure methodical and successful execution of customer change requests
Maintain system stability through advanced troubleshooting, timely resolution of customer incidents, and proactive maintenance
Maintain and improve client loyalty and Net Promoter scores
Partner with the Account and Sales team and aid in the regular Service Reviews. Work with the Account team to build a strong client relationship and grown revenue
Communicating and collaborating with local and global teams.
Essential Duties:

Responsible for the installation and troubleshooting of all copper and fiber customer cross connects.

Perform additional duties such as: Monitor and control access to the Data Center, cleanliness and appearance of raised floor (including physical clean-up) and shipping/receiving duties.
Required skills:
Working knowledge of all OSI layers, TCP/IP model and associated protocols such as DNS.
Highly effective at troubleshooting Layer 1-3 issues (physical, data link and network layers).
Responsible for fiber testing, light testing, continuity ‰ÛÒ Transmit/Receive, DB Loss Level, head-to-head testing.
Must have working knowledge of tools such as ping, traceroute, telnet and nslookup.
2 to 3 years experience with the installation and terminating of CAT5e, CAT6, Fiber (Multi & Single Mode) and Coaxial cable.
Thorough understanding of TIA/EIA-568 and IEEE 802.3 Ethernet fundamentals.
Experience in Structured Cabling. Gather customer requirements, design, install, test and document. To include terminating fiber, connectors (LC/SC, GBIC), dressing and terminating distribution panels/patching, rack and stack, physically able to put together server racks.
Security clearance via Government or other agency background check may be required for customer support.
Utilizing internal systems (Visio, Remedy, and Vantive).
Excellent communication and organizational skills are required.
Strong team player.
Education or Equivalent Experience:
College preferred not required, 2+ years of operational and technical experience in an IT environment required.
IT Certification such as CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network+, Cisco CCENT, familiarity with BICSI is desired.

The CenturyLink Product Commercialization Manager is responsible for leading the product commercialization activities with Sales and the Pricing and Offer Management teams for North America, and removing friction from the sales process. This position is responsible for:

Develop and oversee subordinate level technical methods, procedures, and assist with complex technical solution designs. Develop & document process flows.
Monitor and analyze performance across the organization's Voice Network and underlying LANs, WANs, IPT, and wireless deployments.

The role of the Service Delivery Rep (Solution Delivery Specialist) is to manage the implementation activities for client solutions. As a Service Delivery Rep 3, you will manage the implementation of multiple projects requiring the coordination of technical teams that provision and implement client solutions. You will also function as the single point of contact in which clients will interface with CenturyLink (CTL) through the implementation lifecycle.
Essential Duties:
Manages IT implementation projects for small to medium-sized IT solutions. Project management duties include interpreting technical requirements, conveying work plan tasks to technical personnel, provisioning equipment, and communicating solution status to clients.
Inspects technical design documents for standard IT solutions. Ensures that minimum requirements are met to start up and complete the implementation lifecycle ‰ÛÒ from validating requirements to provisioning and coordinating build activities, and closing the project via client signoff. This includes following the defined protocol when needing to cancel orders or place orders on hold when requirements are not met.
Plans and facilitates kickoff meetings involving 2-3 stakeholder groups. This activity involves allocating CTL engineering and technical resources and reviewing simple technical documents with stakeholders regarding mid-sized solutions.
Plans and facilitates multiple client-facing meetings involving 6-8 technical experts. This activity involves allocating CTL engineering and technical resources and reviewing simple technical documents with stakeholders to review and plan work effort for large, complex solutions.
Manages client expectations by educating clients on streamlined implementation activities, communicating solution status via prescribed communication milestones and form letters.
Documents project information for small-medium size projects. This involves recording implementation activities and miscellaneous notes in CTL business applications in a manner that provides ample information needed to ensure a seamless client experience across all CTL functions.
Position Objectives:
Exhibits a proactive work approach by applying basic project management processes as a means to consistently meet project deadlines. Seeks help through managers and peers when needed in order to ensure the solution integrity and timeliness. Takes ownership and responsibility for decisions and project outcomes.
Able to quickly solve IT problems inherent in mid-sized solutions. Knows how to identify problems, prioritize them, and access resources needed to resolve problems quickly. Knows when to seek engineering and technical expertise to solve problems. Knows when and how to escalate problems for management attention.
Able to work on projects independently. Exhibits a ‰ÛÏtake charge‰Ûù attitude and a propensity to take full ownership/responsibility for getting work done. Experienced managing small system implementations or other IT projects completed in 1-3 month cycles that involve 4-6 team members. Execute basic project management processes. Can explain the basic activities performed when validating requirements, scheduling and managing work plan tasks, identifying and communicating with stakeholders, and managing changes to project scope or completion date.
Able to communicate effectively to individuals and groups of 4-5 people. Demonstrates experience communicating directly with clients in writing and verbally. Able to provide explanations in a clear, concise, and positive manner. Demonstrates an understanding of how to keep diverse groups on-topic using basic meeting facilitation techniques. Maintains a professional composure in highly charged situations.
Process multiple project tasks at a time. Exhibits a systematic and logical approach to prioritizing multiple tasks in a given time period. Demonstrates the ability to work well in team environments and will ‰ÛÏgo the extra mile‰Ûù in assisting senior personnel with complex tasks as needed.
Able to manage issues inherent with mid-size projects. Able to recognize the nature of various change request types and understand the implications on project time and cost. Limited ability to identify risks and use sound judgment when mitigating risks or escalating problems. Demonstrates the importance of setting client expectations and being forthcoming when issues arise. Exhibits confidence in resolving issues and in leveraging internal resources to help resolve them.
Skilled in ensuring positive client experiences. Demonstrates continued awareness of actions and attitude that instill a positive, seamless client experience. Represents the company as a unified entity by referring to business functions as ‰ÛÏwe‰Ûù and demonstrating consistent messaging and work practices to ensure that all interfaces with the client are predictable and repeatable with every subsequent service request. Demonstrates continued pride and confidence in the company‰Ûªs ability to deliver the right solution to the client.

jobs_requirement:
CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The Sr. Director, Global Customer Experience and Technology will be responsible for ensuring the global data center‰Ûªs IT transformation needs are represented, supported and delivered. This high visibility, senior leader position will support the SVP in formatting a smooth and successful transaction establishing a new BU, (NewCo), for Global Data Center Operations (GDCO). This leader will be responsible for the IT strategy for the Colocation Business Unit. The position will have support teams comprised of IT engineers, helpdesk, business continuity; disaster recovery current state. The Sr. Director, Global Customer Experience and Technology will work closely with all centralized functions to serve the interests of global data center services, across all sites to leverage technology to streamline the sales process and support the sales team to accelerate sales, shorten sales cycles and improve conversion rates and deliver a truly positive end user experience.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Functions):
As the Separation/Transition Leader you will be responsible for leading the separation effort, in collaboration with the Executive team and BU leaders to ensure separation planning in areas such as functional readiness, issue resolution and dependency management is effective and complete. The Separation Leader will develop and deliver a cross-functional separation plan of action that ensures the business is positioned to meet short- and long-term strategic business objectives.
The function will be responsible for defining and balancing separation requirements, overseeing project delivery and ensuring little to no impact on customers and business operations throughout the transition to ‰ÛÏstandalone.‰Ûù
Establish influential and collaborative relationships with leadership across all lines of business and functional areas to effectively execute on transitional plans up through separation completion.
Demonstrates strong emphasis towards data integrity to track and report progress of all transition activities under management, to plan appropriately while ensuring risks and issues are identified, escalated and resolved
Shepherd any requested changes through the documentation process, routing documents amongst the Stakeholder groups (Legal, Compliance, Op Dev, IT and Data Center Ops) regarding NewCo.
Develop and institute an effective event management platform that serves the data centers, our customers and senior management with professional and timely event notifications.
Work closely with evolving IT staff to ensure optimum allocation and utilization of technology resources that best support the desired end state.
Attract, develop, motivate and retain highly qualified IT technology staff.
Ensure that the company‰Ûªs IT operations adhere to local laws.
Ensure the security of the business‰Ûª IT assets.
Work closely with internal leadership, partners and executives to create strategic plans for the business future growth
Collaborate cross functionally with leaders to develop and implement new technologies that will drive greater yields across the business

10+ years of technical project manager experience
15+ years in IT & Network Infrastructure planning architecture
10+ years in Customer support role
Infrastructure Transition and/or data center migration project experience is a must
Proven track record of successful project delivery results
Ability to work independently and repeatedly accomplish all work within project plan
Commercially astute with exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Sales orientated with the ability to identify, pursue and assist in closing potential sales opportunities
Experience working within both project-centric and project matrix resourcing models

Job Description:

This person will also provide industry knowledge regarding test strategy development, test R&D activities, and technical support.

Bachelors degree or equivalent education and experience required.
3 + years related experience.
Excellent customer interactions are required
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in telecommunications is a plus.
Experience with hands on automation and testing on an Agile team via the scrum methodology is a plus.

Job Overview:

The Lead Sales Engineer is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements, discovery, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink’s full suite of products and solutions. The Sales Engineer is the account team subject matter expert for: Cloud, telecommunications, data networking, hosting, Virtualization, managed services and CPE solution design/engineering/consulting. The Sales Engineer is also responsible for providing technical training for the sales force. \xa0

Job Responsibilities:

  • Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal Voice, Data, CPE, Hosting or Cloud solutions.
  • Creatively designs solutions for customers using the best mix of CenturyLink, CTS and vendor-partner products. The Lead Sales Engineer will customize the design as needed to result in the customer choosing the CenturyLink solution.
  • Determine client requirements and provide designs for Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites.
  • Understand power, cooling and other environmental constraints on a client’s outsourced infrastructure.
  • Develop and grow technical knowledge base in Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites.
  • Pre-sales design and implementation expertise in CPE and Enterprise/WAN service integration.
  • Documents, via diagrams and writing, and presents the solution to the customer, describes the benefits of the solution Builds relationships with customers by serving as the technical liaison from pre-sales to post-sales, with the goal of being the customer’s trusted advisor.
  • Responsible for growing strategic product sales and revenue through proactive engagement with customers.
  • Participates in strategic and tactical account planning.
  • Follows industry technology trends through self-study and formal training and shares that knowledge with customers.
  • Clearly communicates the customer design to the teams responsible for ordering, implementation and ongoing support.
  • Provides technical training and development support to the local branch.
  • Leads internal cross-functional teams to obtain required approvals of non-standard designs for customers.
  • A good candidate has a strong technical background in layers 1 through 3 of the OSI model and knowledge of the characteristics of various applications that ride over data networks (i.e. the performance requirements of packetized voice and video and of various data applications), has a desire to sell and is comfortable looking for opportunities once introduced to a customer. \xa0

Specifically:

  • Business and technical requirements discovery; ability to craft a solution based on those requirements.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong presentation skills.

\xa0

Technical Knowledge:

  • Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions
  • SAN, NAS, and Cloud Storage Solutions
  • IP routing and switching
  • Internet and MPLS-VPN architecture
  • Voice and VoIP technologies and products
  • Customer premises communication (data, video, voice) equipment from major vendors
  • TDM, SONET and Ethernet technologies and products
  • Data center infrastructure and networking
  • Big Data, Middleware, and Object Storage understanding

\xa0

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Engineering or a related field and/or 6-10 years of equivalent experience in sales engineering, systems engineering (Cloud, Hosting, Managed services, networking services, telephony, IP networking equipment), and/or sales.
  • Strong knowledge of internetworking designs and their applications, to include Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites, IP subnetting and complex routing techniques on LAN/WAN networks, IP Telephony, Security, network diversity applications and other technical skills documented above.
  • Consultative selling and customer questioning techniques in order identify new opportunities, sell within in existing accounts and maintain the role of trusted advisor to both the customer and sales team.
  • Industry leading certifications preferred (Cisco, Juniper and others).
  • Effective presentation, analytical, communications and customer relationship skills.
  • Proficiency with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables. Time management skills are a critical requirement.
  • Valid Driver’s License with satisfactory driving record.

jobs_title: Cloud Product Specialist - Chicago or Minneapolis
jobs_requirement:
CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is a global communications, hosting, cloud and IT services company enabling millions of customers to transform their businesses and their lives through innovative technology solutions. CenturyLink offers network and data systems management, Big Data analytics and IT consulting, and operates more than 55 data centers in North America, Europe and Asia. The company provides broadband, voice, video, data and managed services over a robust 250,000-route-mile U.S. fiber network and a 300,000-route-mile international transport network.
Cloud Product Specialist ‰ÛÒ Chicago or Minneapolis
The Cloud Product Specialist leads technical sales across the CenturyLink (CTL) growing and expanding cloud portfolio. In this role you will work with customers, external and internal, to position and sell the technical benefits of the CTL Cloud Platform within the framework of our customer‰Ûªs business requirements.
The ideal candidate for this position is a leader that has a strong technical (engineering/architecture) background, has had experience or is very comfortable in a business development role and has a strong understanding of the cloud market as it relates to IaaS/PaaS. As the CTL Cloud Platform is continually growing and expanding in capabilities the desire to continually learn new things and be constantly challenged is very highly valued.
This role would be a technical and industry subject matter expert responsible for the integrity of cloud solutions presented to our customer base.
Job Responsibilities:
Evangelize CTL technical cloud capabilities internally and with our customer base
Become a ‰ÛÏtrusted advisor‰Ûù to the sales and SE community within CTL as well as with our customers
Work with our customers to design an environment leveraging networking and security best practices
Position and sell a cloud solution within the context of business goals
Develop strong understanding of the technical capabilities of both the CTL cloud solution as well as key members of our ecosystem program.
Demonstrate the ability to manage and quickly gain respect among subject matter experts within the company.
Qualify and position additional CTL services to extend the value proposition of the Cloud portfolio in Managed services, Networks, Colocation, etc.
Accountable to the regionally assigned Cloud quota.
Minimum Qualifications:
Experience working in the IaaS space is required, Knowledge of PaaS and the Software Development LifeCycle would be highly desired.
5 years‰Ûª experience working in an IT organization or in a technical pre-sales role
Knowledge of how and why organizations are adopting cloud as well as the competitive landscape and overall cloud ecosystem
Strong understanding of use cases for cloud
Excellent communication skills to include: verbal, written and presentation.
Entrepreneurial drive, energy, integrity, and strong work ethic.

Job Overview:
We have an immediate opening for a Customer Service Technician to install telephone plant facilities and high-speed internet at customer premises according to specifications directed and established by CenturyLink procedures. Also to maintain, expand, replace and repair all plant facilities and subscriber apparatus required to provide service to customers. This position interacts directly with CenturyLink customers.
NOTE: This position is posted as a temporary full-time position with no guarantee of full time regular employment.
Job Duties:
Perform installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of high-speed internet, video and voice networks including associated wiring and equipment.
Perform maintenance and repair on outside plant facilities.
Use a shovel and pick to dig up and bury cable; and may be required to work in manholes or controlled environmental vaults (CEV).
Locate buried telephone cables.
Observe all safety rules and regulations.
Assist other Technical personnel in the performance of their duties when requested.
Convey a positive and professional appearance and demeanor when communicating the company‰Ûªs products and services to our customers.
Actively support sales and marketing related activities.
Assume all other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications:
Education: High School Diploma or GED.
Two (2) years of current telecommunications industry experience in one or more of the following areas: installation, maintenance, and repair of aerial, buried and underground wire and cable; High Speed Internet; station equipment.
Prior experience in a customer facing or customer service operation.
Strong interpersonal communication skills for communicating CenturyLink‰Ûªs products and services to customers.
Ability to visually identify all colors used in telephone cable.
Working knowledge of PC‰Ûªs, including basic computer operational tasks.
Ability to handle 28-foot extension ladders (up to 75 lbs) and manhole covers (up to 150 lbs).
Ability to work in confined spaces.
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions and at various hours of the day/night.
Ability to respond to after hour call-outs, work overtime, shift, weekends, and holidays as required.
Ability to travel overnight as necessary for business requirements and training.
Possession of a valid driver‰Ûªs license, with proven ability to safely operate company vehicles and equipment, and maintain a safe driving record.
Preferred Qualifications:
Training on basic IT and network fundamentals.
Experience or training in how to read and interpret outside and subscriber plant facility records.
Internet protocol telephony exposure.
Electronics training or experience that demonstrates knowledge of AC/DC theory.
Knowledge of analog and digital transmission.

Principle Engineer
The Principle Engineer defines requirements from a project's inception to its conclusion for a particular IT subject matter area. Analyses and evaluates recommendations for system improvements, optimization, development, and maintenance efforts in the following specialties: information systems architecture; networking; telecommunications; automation; communications protocols; risk management/electronic analysis; software; life-cycle management; software development methodologies; and modeling and simulation.
Job Responsibilities
Manages schedules to meet Government requirements
Meets with the clients, stakeholders, and customers to define technical project scope. Gathers Government requirements, and performs analyses of technology improvement, optimization, development, maintenance and software applicability plans.
Reviews and provides system engineering resources to meet customer mission requirements, coordinates optimization activities to ensure customer technical goals are considered.
Designs, develops, and modifies Threat software using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and consequences of design as required in response to expanding mission, changes in objectives or upgrades in Agency networks and systems.
Formulates training objectives ,scenarios, and procedures to develop training course content for Government personnel on the Insider Threat Analysis Software.
Modifies existing software to correct errors, adapt to new hardware, or improve threat software performance.
Builds and Deploys software enhancements to resolve issues with Windows and Linux operating systems, and TCP/IP network software.
Coordinates and performs research and engineering to identify and incorporate new data sources, produce new processing and reporting capabilities, integrate with other Government systems and/or processes, or upgraded or reconfigured government systems.
Investigates and implements innovative solutions to threat-monitoring challenges. Implements enterprise-level networking or security products or similar projects.
Performs risk management. Identifies project risks and determines the administrative or engineering means to mitigate the risk.
Investigates, develops, and applies statistical methods, counterintelligence and computer forensic analysis techniques to troubleshoot any issues and resolve challenging network or analysis problems.
Uses software utilities and hardware functionalities to resolve analogous operating issues.
Collaborates with Government to discuss/resolve emerging threats, issues and changes in operating scope.
Documents and briefs Government technical and management staff.
Provides end-to-end research implementation, test, deployment, debugging, operation and analysis of insider threat data and software.
Applies TCP/IP networking and advanced packet analysis tools to support software customization.
Builds implementations of analysis techniques into the tool per customer request and performs analysis to determine the security and effectiveness of existing and proposed customizations.
Provides cause and effect analysis of new/potential sources of unauthorized access to networks, databases and systems and potential mitigation strategies.
Collaborates with Government to discuss/resolve technical issues and/or changes in operating scope. Documents and briefs Government technical and management staff.
Provides documentation for, and briefs to Senior level Government Officials.
Identifies project risks and determines the administrative or engineering means to mitigate the risk.
Provides the overall technical direction of the project.
Coordinates and performs research and engineering to identify/resolve issues, develop new capabilities, and innovate new technologies.
Minimum Qualifications
Twelve (12) years' experience in a related field and a Bachelor's degree in Network systems engineering, programming languages, scientific computing, high-performance computing, or related fields is required.
CCNP or equivalent certification based on Subject Matter Expertise is required or Four (4) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted.
A Masters (MS), or Doctor (Ph.D.) degree in Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field from an accredited college or university may be substituted for experience ( MS = 2 years, Ph.D. = 4 years).

Lead Sales Engineer
Location: Southfield, MI
Job Description:
The Lead Sales Engineer is the technical lead on the account team, responsible for technical and business requirements, discovery, proposal preparation support and technical presentations to customers for CenturyLink‰Ûªs full suite of products and solutions. The Sales Engineer is the account team subject matter expert for: Cloud, telecommunications, data networking, hosting, Virtualization, managed services and CPE solution design/engineering/consulting. The Sales Engineer is also responsible for providing technical training for the sales force.
Essential Duties:
Performs customer discovery discussions to understand and document business needs and design requirements necessary for the formulation of optimal Voice, Data, CPE, Hosting or Cloud solutions.
Creatively designs solutions for customers using the best mix of CenturyLink, CTS and vendor-partner products. The Sales Engineer will customize the design as needed to result in the customer choosing the CenturyLink solution.
Determine client requirements and provide designs for Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites.
Understand power, cooling and other environmental constraints on a client‰Ûªs outsourced infrastructure.
Develop and grow technical knowledge base in Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites.
Pre-sales design and implementation expertise in CPE and Enterprise/WAN service integration.
Documents, via diagrams and writing, and presents the solution to the customer, describes the benefits of the solution.
Builds relationships with customers by serving as the technical liaison from pre-sales to post-sales, with the goal of being the customer‰Ûªs trusted advisor.
Responsible for growing strategic product sales and revenue through proactive engagement with customers.
Participates in strategic and tactical account planning.
Follows industry technology trends through self-study and formal training and shares that knowledge with customers.
Clearly communicates the customer design to the teams responsible for ordering, implementation and ongoing support.
Provides technical training and development support to the local branch.
Leads internal cross-functional teams to obtain required approvals of non-standard designs for customers.
A good candidate has a strong technical background in layers 1 through 3 of the OSI model and knowledge of the characteristics of various applications that ride over data networks (i.e. the performance requirements of packetized voice and video and of various data applications), has a desire to sell and is comfortable looking for opportunities once introduced to a customer. Prior experience as a Sales Engineer isn‰Ûªt required; but rather the skills and knowledge needed to be effective.
Specifically:
Business and technical requirements discovery; ability to craft a solution based on those requirements.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong presentation skills.
Technical Knowledge:
Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions.
SAN, NAS, and Cloud Storage Solutions.
IP routing and switching.
Internet and MPLS-VPN architecture.
Voice and VoIP technologies and products.
Customer premises communication (data, video, voice) equipment from major vendors.
TDM, SONET and Ethernet technologies and products.
Data center infrastructure and networking.
Big Data, Middleware, and Object Storage understanding.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Engineering or a related field and/or 6-10 years of equivalent experience in sales engineering, systems engineering (Cloud, Hosting, Managed services, networking services, telephony, IP networking equipment), and/or sales.
Strong knowledge of internetworking designs and their applications, to include Managed Hosting Services, Cloud, Virtualization, Outsourced infrastructure solutions (managed and un-managed), specialized Enterprise application suites, IP subnetting and complex routing techniques on LAN/WAN networks, IP Telephony, Security, network diversity applications and other technical skills documented above.
Consultative selling and customer questioning techniques in order identify new opportunities, sell within in existing accounts and maintain the role of trusted advisor to both the customer and sales team.
Industry leading certifications preferred (Cisco, Juniper and others).
Effective presentation, analytical, communications and customer relationship skills.
Proficiency with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio.
Strong project management skills.
Ability to work autonomously on multiple projects and associated deliverables. Time management skills are a critical requirement.
Must have a valid Driver‰Ûªs License with satisfactory driving record.
